NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION RALEIGH STANDARD SPECIFICATIONS FOR ROADS AND STRUCTURES JANUARY 2018 FOREWORD This publication has been prepared to provide a compilation of standard requirements used by the North Carolina Department of Transportation for construction contracts .
When this publication , entitled Standard Specifications for Roads and Structures , dated January 2018 , is incorporated by reference into the Department ’ s construction bid proposals or contracts ; it is made a part of that document and shall be known as the Standard Specifications .
The requirements stated herein may be revised or amended from time to time by Supplemental Specifications , by Standard Special Provisions which are unique to a select group of projects or by Project Special Provisions which are unique to the specific bid proposal or contract .
Working titles have a masculine gender , such as workman , workmen and foreman .
Pronouns such as he , his , and him are used in the Standard Specifications for the sake of brevity and are intended to refer to persons of either sex or corporate entities .
Reference by title and date will be made to the governing provisions on plans and contract documents .
GENERAL INFORMATION For general questions about this publication , please contact the Contract Standards and Development Unit at specs @ ncdot.gov or ( 919 ) 707-6900 .
ORDERING INFORMATION Copies of the Standard Specifications and the Roadway Standard Drawings may be purchased through the Contract Standards and Development Unit : North Carolina Department of Transportation Contract Standards and Development Unit – Manual Distribution 1591 Mail Service Center Raleigh , NC 27699-1591 Telephone : ( 919 ) 707-6944 Website : http : //www.ncdot.gov/ The order form is available at http : //www.ncdot.gov/business/order/puborder.html .
Electronic copies of the Standard Specifications and the Roadway Standard Drawings are available for download on the Contract Standards and Development Unit ’ s website at https : //connect.ncdot.gov/resources/Specifications/Pages/default.aspx .

3 ADDITIONAL WORK : Additional work is that which results from a change or alteration to 4 the contract and for which there are existing contract unit prices .
5 ADVERTISEMENT : The public advertisement inviting bids for the construction of specific 6 projects .
7 AMOUNT BID : The amount bid for a particular item of work in a proposal .
8 ARTICLE : A primary numbered subdivision of a section of the Standard Specifications .
9 AWARD : The decision of the Department of Transportation to accept the bid of the lowest 10 responsible responsive bidder for work that is subject to the furnishing of payment and 11 performance bonds and such other conditions as may be otherwise provided by law , the 12 proposal and these specifications .
13 BASE COURSE : That portion of the pavement structure of planned thickness placed 14 immediately below the pavement or surface course .
15 BID ( OR PROPOSAL ) : Paper Bid : The offer of a bidder on the proposal furnished by the 16 Department to perform the work and to furnish the labor and materials at the prices quoted .
17 Section 101 1-4 Electronic Bid : The electronic offer of a bidder via Bid Express® to the Department to 1 perform the work and to furnish the labor and materials at the prices quoted .
2 BID BOND OR BID DEPOSIT : The security furnished by the bidder with his bid as 3 guaranty that he will furnish the required bonds and execute such documents as may be 4 required if his bid is accepted .
5 BIDDER : An individual , partnership , firm , corporation , LLC or joint venture formally 6 submitting a bid for the work contemplated .
7 BOARD OR BOARD OF TRANSPORTATION : The Board created by the provisions of 8 NCGS § 143B-350 for formulating policies for the Department of Transportation and 9 awarding all transportation construction contracts .
10 BRIDGE : A structure including supports , erected over a depression or an obstruction such as 11 water , highway or railway , and having a track or passage way for carrying traffic or other 12 moving loads and having a length measured along the center of the roadway of more than 13 20 ft between undercopings of end supports , spring lines of arches or between extreme ends 14 of openings for multiple reinforced concrete box structures .
15 BRIDGE LENGTH : The length of a bridge structure is the overall length measured along 16 the line of survey stationing back to back of backwalls of abutments , if present , otherwise end 17 to end of the bridge floor .
18 BRIDGE WIDTH : The clear width measured at right angles to the longitudinal centerline of 19 the bridge between the bottom of curbs , guard timbers or face of parapets , or in the case of 20 multiple heights of curbs , between the bottoms of the lower risers .
21 CALENDAR DAY : A day shown on the calendar beginning and ending at midnight .
22 CHIEF ENGINEER : The Chief Engineer , Division of Highways , North Carolina 23 Department of Transportation acting directly or through his duly authorized representatives .
24 COMPLETION DATE : That date established as set forth in the contract or as revised by 25 authorized extensions , by which it is required that the work set forth in the contract be 26 satisfactorily completed .
When observation periods are required by the Specifications , they 27 are not a part of the work to be completed by the completion date or intermediate contract 28 times stated in the contract unless otherwise noted .
29 CONSTRUCTION EASEMENT : A right owned by the Department of Transportation in 30 a parcel of land owned by a third party outside the highway right of way for containing 31 construction that exceeds the right of way .
32 CONTRACT : The executed agreement between the Department and the successful bidder , 33 covering the performance of and compensation for the work .
34 The term contract is all inclusive with reference to all written and electronic agreements 35 affecting a contractual relationship and all documents referred to therein .
The contract shall 36 include , but not be limited to , the proposal , the printed contract form and attachments , 37 contract bonds , plans , standard specifications and supplemental specifications , standard 38 special provisions and project special provisions contained in the proposal and all executed 39 supplemental agreements .
All references to contracts shall include electronic agreements and 40 printed paper agreements .
These may include , but not be limited to , the electronic bid bond , 41 Non-Collusion Certification , Debarment Certification , Gift Ban Certification and award 42 limits .
43 The contract shall constitute one instrument .
44 CONTRACT ITEM : A specifically described unit of work for which a unit or lump sum 45 price is provided in the contract .
Synonymous with Pay Item .
46 Section 101 1-5 CONTRACT LUMP SUM PRICE : The amount bid for a lump sum item that has been 1 submitted by the Contractor in his proposal .
2 CONTRACT PAYMENT BOND : A bond furnished by the Contractor and his corporate 3 surety securing the payment of those furnishing labor , materials and supplies for the 4 construction of the project .
5 CONTRACT PERFORMANCE BOND : A bond furnished by the Contractor and his 6 corporate surety guaranteeing the performance of the contract .
7 CONTRACT TIME : The number of calendar days inclusive between the date of availability 8 and the completion date , said dates being established as set forth in the special provisions , 9 including authorized extensions to the completion date .
10 CONTRACT UNIT PRICE : The unit bid price for a unit item that has been submitted by 11 the Contractor in his proposal .
12 CONTRACTOR : The successful bidder to whom the contract has been awarded , and who 13 has executed the contract and furnished acceptable contract bonds .
14 CULVERT : Any structure not classified as a bridge that provides an opening under the 15 roadway .
16 CURRENT CONTROLLING OPERATION OR OPERATIONS : Any operation or 17 operations , as determined by the Engineer , that if delayed would delay the completion of the 18 project .
19 DATE OF AVAILABILITY : That date , established as set forth in the special provisions , by 20 which it is anticipated that sufficient work sites within the project limits will be available for 21 the Contractor to begin his controlling operations that are not otherwise limited by 22 moratoriums , listed third party conflicts , or by weather conditions .
23 DEPARTMENT or DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION : A principal department 24 of the Executive Branch that performs the functions of planning , design , construction and 25 maintenance of an integrated statewide transportation system .
26 DIVISION OF HIGHWAYS : The division of the Department of Transportation that , under 27 the direction of the Secretary of Transportation , carries out state highway planning , design , 28 construction and maintenance functions assigned to the Department of Transportation .
29 DRAINAGE EASEMENT : A right , owned by the Department of Transportation , in a parcel 30 of land owned by a third party outside the highway right of way , to construct and maintain 31 ditches , channels , or structures for directing the course and flow of water outside the highway 32 right of way .
33 EASEMENT : A property right to use or control real property of another .
34 ENGINEER : The Chief Engineer of the North Carolina Department of Transportation , 35 acting directly or through a duly authorized representative , such representative acting within 36 the scope of particular assigned duties or authority .
37 EQUIPMENT : All machinery and equipment , together with the necessary supplies , tools 38 and apparatus for upkeep and maintenance , all of which are necessary for the proper 39 construction and acceptable completion of the work .
40 EXTRA WORK : Work found necessary or desirable to fully complete the work as 41 contemplated in the contract for which payment is not provided for by the contract unit or 42 lump sum prices in the original contract .
Extra work shall not be work that in the terms of the 43 contract is incidental to work for which there is a contract price or work that payment is 44 included in some other contract unit or lump sum price .
45 Section 101 1-6 FINAL ACCEPTANCE DATE : That date on which all work set forth in the contract and 1 work modified by the Engineer is satisfactorily completed excluding any observation periods 2 not specifically made a part of the work by the specifications or special provisions .
3 FINAL ESTIMATE : The document that contains a final statement of all quantities and total 4 dollar amount for each item of work performed during the life of the contract including any 5 adjustments to those amounts made under the terms of the contract .
The final statement will 6 be titled The Final Estimate and will be the document used to document final payment to the 7 Contractor .
Receipt of this document by the Contractor will begin the time frame for filing of 8 a verified claim with the Department as provided for in NCGS § 136-29 .
9 FINAL ESTIMATE ASSEMBLY : As constructed plans and other project records that 10 establish the final statement of quantities to be paid and document work performed on the 11 project .
12 FORCE ACCOUNT NOTICE : A written notice to the Contractor that extra work ordered 13 by the Engineer will be paid as force account work .
14 FORCE ACCOUNT WORK : Work that is paid in accordance with Article 109-3 or on the 15 basis of the force account formula provided in the contract .
16 HIGHWAY : A general term denoting a public way for purposes of vehicular travel , 17 including the entire area within the right of way .
Synonymous with Road and Street .
18 HOUR : One of the 24 equal parts of a day .
19 INSPECTOR : The authorized representative of the Engineer assigned to make a detailed 20 inspection of any or all portions of the work and materials .
21 INTERMEDIATE COMPLETION DATE : That date established as set forth in the special 22 provisions or as revised by authorized extensions , by which date it is required that the portion 23 of work set forth in the contract be satisfactorily completed .
24 INTERMEDIATE COMPLETION TIME : The time established as set forth in the special 25 provisions or as revised by authorized extensions , by which it is required that the portion of 26 work set forth in the contract be satisfactorily completed .
27 INTERMEDIATE CONTRACT TIME ( DAYS ) : The number of calendar days inclusive 28 between the date of availability and the intermediate completion date , said days being 29 established as set forth in the special provisions , or as revised by authorized extensions , by 30 which it is required that a portion of that work set forth in the contract be satisfactorily 31 completed .
32 INTERMEDIATE CONTRACT TIME ( HOURS ) : The number of hours inclusive 33 between the time of availability and the intermediate completion time , said times being 34 established as set forth in the special provisions , including authorized extensions to the 35 intermediate completion time .
36 INVERT : The lowest point in the internal cross section of a pipe or other culvert .
37 INVITATION TO BID : The notification that bids will be received for the construction of 38 specific projects .
39 LABORATORY : The testing laboratory of the Department of Transportation or any other 40 testing laboratory that may be designated or approved by the Engineer .
41 LOCAL TRAFFIC : Traffic that must use the facility under construction to reach its 42 destination .
43 MAJOR AND MINOR CONTRACT ITEMS : Major contract items are listed as such in 44 the project special provisions .
All other original contract items and extra work shall be 45 considered as minor items .
46 Section 101 1-7 MATERIALS : Any substances that may be incorporated into the construction of the project .
1 MEDIAN : The center section of a divided highway that separates the traffic lanes in one 2 direction from the traffic lanes in the opposite direction .
3 MOBILIZATION : The work described in Article 800-1 .
4 PAVEMENT STRUCTURE : The combination of base and surface courses placed on 5 a subgrade to support the traffic load and distribute it to the roadbed .
6 PAY ITEM : Synonymous with Contract Item .
7 PLANS : The approved plans , profiles , typical roadway sections , appropriate standard 8 drawings , supplemental plans and working drawings , or exact reproductions thereof , that 9 show the location , dimensions and details of the work to be done and that are a part of the 10 contract .
11 PREBID CONFERENCE : A conference held before bids are accepted on a project at which 12 representatives of the Department will provide information and accept and answer questions 13 from interested parties .
14 PROJECT : The work specified under the contract .
15 PROJECT SPECIAL PROVISIONS : Special provisions peculiar to the project and not 16 otherwise thoroughly or appropriately set forth in the standard specifications or plans .
17 PROPOSAL : The electronic or paper document provided by the Department that the bidder 18 uses to develop his electronic or paper offer to perform the work at designated bid prices .
19 PURCHASE ORDER BIDDER : A Bidder that can bid on any Department Purchase Order 20 Contract or Division Let Contract .
21 RIGHT OF WAY : The land area shown in the plans as right of way to be furnished by the 22 Department of Transportation within which the project is to be constructed .
23 ROAD : Synonymous with Highway and Street .
24 ROADBED : The graded portion of a highway usually considered as the area between the 25 intersections of top and side slopes , upon which the base course , surface course , shoulders and 26 medians are constructed .
27 ROADSIDE : A general term denoting the area within the limits of the right of way adjoining 28 the outer edge of the roadway .
Extensive areas between the roadways of a divided highway 29 may be considered roadside .
30 ROADWAY : The portion of a highway within limits of construction .
31 SECTION : A numbered chapter of the standard specifications .
32 SHOULDER : The portion of the roadway adjacent to the traveled way for accommodation 33 of stopped vehicles , for emergency use and for lateral support of base and surface courses .
34 SIDEWALK : That portion of the roadway primarily constructed for pedestrian traffic .
35 SKEW ANGLE : The angle between the centerline of the project and the centerline of a pipe , 36 culvert , bridge pier , bent , abutment , or other drainage feature , measured to the right of the 37 project centerline facing in the direction of progressing stations .
38 SPECIAL PROVISIONS : Project special provisions and standard special provisions taken 39 together as one body of special provisions .
40 SPECIFICATIONS : The general term comprising all the directions , provisions and 41 requirements contained or referred to in the Standard Specifications , including the 42 Supplemental Specifications , together with such additional directions , provisions and 43 requirements that may be added or adopted as special provisions .
44 Section 101 1-8 STANDARD DRAWINGS : The general term comprising all the directions , provisions and 1 requirements contained or referred to in the book entitled Roadway Standard Drawings and in 2 any subsequent revisions or additions to such book that are issued as Detail Drawings .
3 STANDARD SPECIAL PROVISIONS : Special directions or requirements not otherwise 4 thoroughly or appropriately set forth in the standard specifications and that are peculiar to 5 a selected group of projects .
6 STANDARD SPECIFICATIONS : The general term comprising all the directions , 7 provisions and requirements contained or referred to in this book entitled Standard 8 Specifications for Roads and Structures and in any subsequent revisions or additions to such 9 book that are issued as Supplemental Specifications .
10 STATE : The State of North Carolina .
11 STATION : A station , when used as a term of measurement , will be 100 linear feet measured 12 horizontally .
When used as a location , it will be a designated point on the project .
13 STREET : Synonymous with Highway and Road .
14 SUBCONTRACTOR : An individual , partnership , firm , joint venture , LLC or corporation to 15 whom the Contractor , with the written consent of the Engineer , sublets any part of the 16 contract .
17 SUBGRADE : That portion of the roadbed prepared as a foundation for the pavement 18 structure including curb and gutter .
On portions of projects that do not include the 19 construction of a base course or pavement , the presence of the subgrade will not be 20 recognized during the life of such contract .
21 SUBSTRUCTURE : All of that part of the structure below the bearings of simple and 22 continuous spans , spans , skew back of arches and tops of footings of rigid frames , together 23 with the backwalls and wingwalls .
24 SUCCESSFUL BIDDER : The bidder awarded a contract .
25 SUPERINTENDENT : The representative of the Contractor authorized to supervise and 26 direct the construction for the Contractor and to receive and fulfill directions from the 27 Engineer .
28 SUPERSTRUCTURE : All of the part of the structure exclusive of the substructure .
29 SUPPLEMENTAL AGREEMENT : A written agreement between the Contractor and the 30 Department of Transportation covering amendments to the contract .
31 SUPPLEMENTAL SPECIFICATIONS : Specifications , regulations , standards , manuals or 32 codes referenced in the contract or general revisions or additions to this book of standard 33 specifications that are issued under the title of Supplemental Specifications .
Supplemental 34 Specifications shall be considered part of the Standard Specifications .
35 SURETY : A corporate bonding company furnishing the bid bond or furnishing the contract 36 payment and performance bonds .
37 TEMPORARY CONSTRUCTION EASEMENT : A temporary right , owned by the 38 Department of Transportation , in a parcel of land owned by a third party outside the highway 39 right of way , for the use of the Department of Transportation during the construction and that 40 reverts to the third party on completion of construction .
41 THROUGH TRAFFIC : Traffic that can reach its destination by a route or routes other than 42 the facility under construction .
43 TIME OF AVAILABILITY : That time established as set forth in the special provisions , by 44 which it is anticipated that sufficient work sites within the project limits will be available for 45 the Contractor to begin his controlling operations .
46 Section 102 1-9 TOTAL AMOUNT BID : Same as total price bid .
The total amount bid will be considered 1 to be the correct sum total obtained by adding together the amounts bid for every item in the 2 proposal other than items that are authorized alternates to those items for which an amount bid 3 has been established .
4 UNBALANCED BID : A bid that includes any unbalanced bid price .
5 UNBALANCED BID PRICE : A unit or lump sum bid price that does not reflect reasonable 6 actual costs that the bidder anticipates for the performance of the item in question along with 7 a reasonable proportionate share of the bidder 's anticipated profit , overhead costs and other 8 indirect costs .
9 WORK : Work shall mean the furnishing of all labor , materials , equipment and incidentals 10 necessary or convenient to the successful completion of the project , or any part , portion or 11 phase thereof , and the carrying out of all duties and obligations imposed by the contract .
12 WORKING DRAWINGS : Stress sheets , shop drawings , erection drawings , falsework 13 drawings , cofferdam drawings , catalog cuts , or any other supplementary drawings or similar 14 data that the Contractor is required to submit to the Engineer for review or approval .

27 102-2 CONTRACTOR PREQUALIFICATION 28 Contractors desiring to perform work on Department projects shall prequalify with the 29 Department .
Upon prequalification , contractors will be placed on the Department ’ s 30 Prequalified Contractors ’ List on the Directory of Transportation Firms .
The requirements for 31 prequalification are as follows : 32 ( A ) Bidder Prequalification 33 ( 1 ) Applicant shall submit a completed Bidder Experience Questionnaire , along with any 34 additional supporting information requested by the Department , as noted in the 35 experience questionnaire package .
Additional requirements for prequalification may 36 be set forth in the bid proposal .
37 ( 2 ) Applicant shall demonstrate that he has sufficient ability and experience in related 38 transportation construction projects to perform the work specified in the 39 Department ’ s contracts , including the type and dollar value of previous contracts .
40 ( 3 ) Applicant shall demonstrate a history of successful performance and completion of 41 projects in a timely manner , subject to contract time adjustments .
42 ( 4 ) Applicant shall demonstrate the financial ability to furnish bonds as specified in 43 NCGS § 44A-26 and any other relevant statutes .
44 ( 5 ) Applicant shall demonstrate sufficient and readily available equipment to perform 45 transportation construction contracts in a timely manner .
46 Section 102 1-10 ( 6 ) Applicant shall demonstrate sufficient available experienced personnel to perform 1 transportation construction contracts .
The identities and qualifications of both 2 management and labor work force shall be provided .
3 ( 7 ) Applicant shall provide names and addresses of persons for whom the firm has 4 performed related work .
Responses from the references shall be on Department 5 forms and shall be received by the Department before evaluating the request for 6 prequalification .
7 ( 8 ) Applicant shall provide any information requested concerning the corporate and 8 operational management structure of the company , the identity of persons or entities 9 owning stock or other equity interest in the company , and the relationship between 10 the applicant and any other company prequalified or applying for prequalification 11 with the Department .
12 ( 9 ) Applicant shall demonstrate , at the time of application for prequalification , the 13 financial capacity to successfully complete projects containing the work types they 14 so designate .
15 ( 10 ) Applicant shall provide further information as may be required to determine that the 16 firm is a responsible bidder .
17 ( 11 ) Applicant shall submit a completed Pre-Bid Non-Collusion Certification , Debarment 18 Certification and Gift Ban Certification in accordance with Article 102-9 .
These 19 forms can be found on the Department ’ s website .
20 ( 12 ) Applicant shall submit a completed Safety Index Rating Form with the Questionnaire 21 and annually thereafter in accordance with Subarticle 102-2 ( D ) .
22 Bidders shall renew annually and shall requalify every 3 years in accordance with 23 Subarticle 102-2 ( E ) .
24 The Bidder Experience Questionnaire shall be completed in its entirety and signed by 25 an officer of the firm .
The officer ’ s signature shall be notarized .
In addition to 26 submitting the Bidder Experience Questionnaire , the prospective bidder shall submit 27 supporting information in a format of his choosing to address the requirements listed 28 above .
29 It is recommended that the prospective bidder file all required statements and documents 30 with the State Contractual Services Engineer no less than 4 weeks before a given letting .
31 A bid shall not be opened unless all prequalification requirements have been met by the 32 bidder and have been found acceptable by the Engineer .

47 Section 102 1-12 ( D ) Safety Index 1 The Department will conduct a review of each firm ’ s safety index .
To be prequalified , 2 each firm shall maintain a satisfactory safety index .
An overall safety index of at least 60 3 is considered satisfactory .
An index between 60 and 69 may be considered marginal 4 results in an in-depth safety audit of a firm ’ s safety practices and may result in one or 5 more of the sanctions listed below as a result of a failing Safety Index .
An overall safety 6 index equal to or less than 59 is considered unsatisfactory and will prohibit 7 prequalification of new firms .
8 A score of 59 or less for renewing or requalifying firms will result in disciplinary action 9 pursuant to Subarticles 102-2 ( D ) ( 1 ) through 102-2 ( D ) ( 4 ) .
The Engineer may require the 10 Contractor to state in writing the reason for the unsatisfactory rating and produce such 11 supporting data as may be necessary to evaluate the circumstances surrounding the rating .
12 When the Contractor can not provide justification to raise the unsatisfactory safety index , 13 the Engineer may invoke one or more of the following sanctions : 14 ( 1 ) Removal of the firm from the Prequalified Contractors ’ List , 15 ( 2 ) Placement of the firm on probation for up to 2 years , 16 ( 3 ) Auditing of the firm ’ s safety practices and 17 ( 4 ) Giving a written warning to correct any safety deficiencies .
18 Firms not approved or disqualified to bid or perform subcontract work due to 19 an unsatisfactory safety index will not be approved or reinstated to bid or perform 20 subcontract work until they can provide adequate evidence that all safety deficiencies 21 have been corrected to the satisfaction of the Engineer .
22 ( E ) Renewal and Requalification 23 Renewal of firms shall occur annually on or before the firm ’ s anniversary date .
Renewal 24 shall consist of submitting an updated application .
Bids of firms who fail to submit these 25 documents by their anniversary date will be deemed non-responsive and not considered 26 for award .
The Engineer may review performance related issues when considering firms 27 for renewal .
Subcontractors who fail to submit these documents by their anniversary date 28 will not be allowed to begin work on any new contracts until these documents are 29 received and approved by the Engineer .
30 Requalifying of firms shall occur every 3 years .
Requalifying shall consist of submitting 31 an updated application .
Bids of firms who fail to submit these documents by their 32 anniversary date will be deemed non-responsive and not considered for award .
The 33 Engineer may review performance related issues when considering firms for 34 requalification .
Subcontractors who fail to submit these documents by their anniversary 35 date will not be allowed to begin work on any new contracts until these documents are 36 received and approved by the Engineer .
37 It is recommended that the renewing or requalifying firm file all required statements and 38 documents with the State Contractual Services Engineer no less than 4 weeks before a 39 given letting for their bid to be considered .
Following the anniversary date , a bid will not 40 be opened unless all renewal or requalification requirements have been met by the bidder 41 and have been found acceptable by the Engineer .
Following the anniversary date , a 42 subcontractor may not begin any new work unless all renewal or requalification 43 requirements have been met by the firm and have been found acceptable by the Engineer .

44 Section 102 1-14 102-7 SUBSURFACE INVESTIGATION REPORT 1 If a subsurface investigation report is available on a project , an electronic copy is available 2 on-line with the project letting files .
3 The subsurface report and the subsurface investigation on which it is based were made for 4 study , planning and design and not for construction or pay purposes .
The various field boring 5 logs , rock cores and soil test data available may be reviewed or inspected .
Contact the 6 Geotechnical Engineering Unit to set up an appointment in the appropriate Regional office .
7 The subsurface investigation report , the field boring logs , rock cores , and soil test data are not 8 part of the contract documents .
9 General soil and rock strata descriptions and indicated boundaries are based on a geotechnical 10 interpretation of available subsurface data and do not necessarily reflect the actual subsurface 11 conditions between borings or between sampled strata within the borehole .
The laboratory 12 sample data and the in-place test data can be relied on only to the degree of reliability inherent 13 in the standard test method .
The observed water levels or soil moisture conditions indicated 14 in the subsurface investigations are as recorded at the time of the investigation .
These water 15 levels or soil moisture conditions may vary considerably with time according to climatic 16 conditions including temperature , precipitation and wind , as well as other nonclimatic factors .
17 Details shown in the subsurface investigation report are preliminary only and the final design 18 details may be different .
For bidding and construction purposes , refer to the contract for final 19 design information on this project .
The Department does not warrant or guarantee the 20 sufficiency or accuracy of the investigation made , nor the interpretations made or opinions of 21 the Department as to the type of materials and conditions that may be encountered .
The 22 bidder or contractor shall make independent subsurface investigations , as to conditions to be 23 encountered on this project .
The Contractor assumes all risks for any discrepancies between 24 the subsurface information and the actual conditions encountered and expressly agrees that 25 NCDOT is not liable for any such variances and shall have no claim for additional 26 compensation or for an extension of time for any reason resulting from the actual conditions 27 encountered at the site differing from those indicated in the subsurface investigation .
28 102-8 PREPARATION AND SUBMISSION OF BIDS 29 The bidder shall submit a unit or lump sum price for every item in the proposal other than 30 items that are authorized alternates to those items for which a bid price has been submitted .

The bid bond shall be completely and properly 44 executed in accordance with Article 102-10 .
The bid deposit shall be a certified 45 check or cashier ’ s check in accordance with Article 102-10 .
46 ( 2 ) All entries including signatures shall be written in ink .
47 Section 102 1-15 ( 3 ) The unit prices shall be rounded off by the bidder to contain no more than 4 decimal 1 places .
2 ( 4 ) An amount bid shall be entered in the proposal for every item on which a unit price 3 has been submitted .
The amount bid for each item other than lump sum items shall 4 be determined by multiplying each unit bid price by the quantity for that item and 5 shall be written in figures in the Amount Bid column in the proposal .
6 ( 5 ) In the case of lump sum items , the price shall be written in figures in the Amount Bid 7 column in the proposal .
8 ( 6 ) The total amount bid shall be written in figures in the proper place in the proposal .

13 ( 8 ) The bid shall be properly executed .

19 ( b ) If the bid is by a corporation , the President , Vice President , or Assistant Vice 20 President shall execute it in the name of the corporation .
The Secretary or 21 Assistant Secretary shall attest it .
The seal of the corporation shall be affixed .
If 22 the bid is executed on behalf of a corporation in any other manner than as above , 23 a certified copy of the minutes of the Board of Directors of said corporation 24 authorizing the manner and style of execution and the authority of the person 25 executing shall be attached to the bid or shall be on file with the Department .
26 ( c ) If the bid is made by a partnership , it shall be executed in the name of the 27 partnership by one of the general partners .
28 ( d ) If the bid is made by a limited liability company , it shall be signed by the 29 manager , member or authorized agent and notarized .
30 ( e ) If the bid is a joint venture , it shall be executed by each member of the joint 31 venturers in the appropriate manner set out above .
In addition , the execution by 32 the joint venturers shall appear below their names .
33 ( f ) The bid execution shall be notarized by a notary public whose commission is in 34 effect on the date of execution .

15 102-9 NON-COLLUSION CERTIFICATION , DEBARMENT CERTIFICATION 16 AND GIFT BAN CERTIFICATION 17 ( A ) General 18 Prime Contractors and lower tier participants in each transaction involving public funds 19 shall execute a Non-Collusion Certification , Debarment Certification and Gift Ban 20 Certification .
Transactions that require certifications from lower tier participants are : 21 ( 1 ) Transactions between a Prime Contractor and a person , other than for a procurement 22 contract , for goods or services , regardless of type .
23 ( 2 ) Procurement contracts for goods and services , between a prime contractor and 24 a person , regardless of type , expected to equal or exceed the Federal small purchase 25 threshold fixed at 10 U.S.C .
2304 ( g ) under a prime contract .
26 ( 3 ) Procurement contracts for goods or services between a prime contractor and 27 a person , regardless of the amount , under which that person will have a critical 28 influence on or substantive control over the transaction .
Such persons include , but 29 are not limited to , bid estimators and contract managers .
30 The certifications for both the Prime Contractor and the lower tier participants shall be on 31 a form furnished by the Department to comply with Federal Highway Administration 32 requirements , as published in 49 CFR Part 29 .
The Prime Contractor is responsible for 33 obtaining the certifications from the lower tier participants and is responsible for keeping 34 them as part of the contract records .
35 ( B ) Non-Collusion Certification 36 In compliance with applicable Federal and State laws and regulations , each and every 37 bidder shall furnish the Department with a form certifying that the bidder has not entered 38 into any agreement , participated in any collusion , or otherwise taken any action in 39 restraint of free competitive bidding in connection with his bid on the project .
The 40 certification shall conclusively indicate that the bidder intends to do the work with its 41 own bona fide employees or subcontractors and is not bidding for the benefit of another 42 contractor .
43 ( C ) Debarment Certification 44 In compliance with applicable Federal and State laws and regulations , each and every 45 bidder shall furnish the Department with a debarment certification , stating that he is not 46 Section 102 1-17 debarred , or if he is debarred , an explanation shall be included .
The explanation will not 1 necessarily result in denial of participation in a contract .
Failure to furnish a certification 2 or an explanation will be grounds for rejection of a bid .
If the prequalified bidder ’ s status 3 changes , he shall immediately submit a new fully executed debarment certification with 4 an explanation of the change .
5 Failure to have a fully executed Non-Collusion Certification , Debarment Certification 6 and Gift Ban Certification on file in the Contractual Services Office before submitting 7 bids will cause those bids to be non-responsive .
8 ( 1 ) Paper Bid 9 Execution of Bid , Non-Collusion Certification , Debarment Certification and Gift 10 Ban Certification forms will be included in the proposal as part of the signature 11 sheets .
Execution of the signature sheets will constitute Execution of the Bid , 12 Non-Collusion Certification , Debarment Certification and Gift Ban Certification .
13 ( 2 ) Electronic Bids 14 The prequalified bidder shall have a fully executed Non-Collusion Certification , 15 Debarment Certification and Gift Ban Certification on file in the Contractual 16 Services Office before submitting his bid .
Forms may be downloaded from the 17 Department ’ s website .
18 The bidder shall provide a Debarment Certification in the electronic bid submittal .
If 19 a bidder can not provide the Debarment Certification required , he shall provide 20 an explanation in the Bid Express® miscellaneous folder within the .ebs file .
21 Within 14 calendar days after notice of award is received by him , the successful 22 bidder shall submit a fully executed Execution of Contract , Non-Collusion 23 Certification , Debarment Certification and Gift Ban Certification signature sheet .
24 102-10 BID BOND OR BID DEPOSIT 25 Each bid shall be accompanied by a corporate bid bond or a bid deposit of a certified or 26 cashier ’ s check in the amount of at least 5 % of the total amount bid for the contract .
When 27 a bid is secured by a bid deposit , the execution of a bid bond will not be required .
28 If the bidder has failed to meet all conditions of the bid bond and the Department has not 29 received the amount due under the bid bond , the bidder may be disqualified from further 30 bidding as provided in Article 102-15 .
31 No bid will be considered or accepted unless accompanied by one of the foregoing securities .
32 The bid bond shall be executed by a corporate surety licensed to do business in 33 North Carolina .
The certified check or cashier ’ s check shall be drawn on a bank or trust 34 company insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation .
Both shall be made payable 35 to the Department of Transportation in an amount of at least 5 % of the total amount bid for 36 the contract .
The condition of the bid bond or bid deposit is : the Principal shall not withdraw 37 its bid within 60 days after the opening of same and , if the Department shall award a contract 38 to the Principal , the Principal shall , within 14 calendar days after the notice of award is 39 received by him , give payment and performance bonds with good and sufficient surety as 40 required for the faithful performance of the contract and for the protection of all persons 41 supplying labor and materials in the prosecution of the work .
In the event of the failure of the 42 Principal to give such payment and performance bonds as required , then the amount of the bid 43 bond shall be immediately paid to the Department as liquidated damages , or , in the case of a 44 bid deposit , the deposit shall be forfeited to the Department .
45 Withdrawal of a bid due to a mistake made in the preparation of the bid , where permitted by 46 Article 103-3 , shall not constitute withdrawal of a bid as cause for payment of the bid bond or 47 forfeiture of the bid deposit .

2 102-13 RECEIPT AND OPENING OF BIDS 3 A bid will be received and opened from any bidder who : 4 ( A ) Is prequalified in accordance with the provisions of Article 102-2 and 5 ( B ) Has delivered the bid to the place indicated in the contract before the time indicated in the 6 Invitation to Bid .

16 102-14 REJECTION OF BIDS 17 Any bid submitted that fails to comply with any of the requirements of Articles 102-8 , 102-9 18 and 102-10 shall be considered irregular and may be rejected .
19 Irregularities due to apparent clerical errors and omissions may be waived in accordance with 20 Article 103-2 .
21 Any bid including any unit or lump sum bid price that is unbalanced to the potential detriment 22 of the Department will be considered irregular and may be rejected .
In the event the Board 23 determines it is in the best public interest to accept such irregular bid , it may award the 24 contract based on such bid subject to Subarticle 109-4 ( C ) .
25 All bidders shall comply with all applicable laws regulating the practice of general contracting 26 as contained in Chapter 87 of the General Statutes of North Carolina , except where waived by 27 the Department by project special provision for certain specialty work .
Bidders shall comply 28 with all other applicable laws regulating the practices of electrical , plumbing , heating and air 29 conditioning and refrigeration contracting as contained in Chapter 87 of the General Statutes 30 of North Carolina .
31 ( A ) State Funded Projects 32 The bidder shall be licensed by the North Carolina Licensing Board for General 33 Contractors where the bid is $ 30,000 or more .
Bids received from bidders not meeting 34 this requirement will be considered non-responsive and will not be considered for award .
35 ( B ) Federal Aid Projects 36 The bidder is not required to be licensed by the North Carolina Licensing Board for 37 General Contractors to place a bid of $ 30,000 or more .
However , a project may not be 38 awarded until the bidder provides evidence that the appropriate General Contractor 39 license has been obtained .
The license shall be obtained within 60 days of bid opening or 40 the project may be awarded to another bidder or all bids rejected .
No contract time 41 extension will be considered for delays associated with obtaining a license .
42 The right to reject any and all bids shall be reserved to the Department .
43 Section 102 1-20 102-15 DISQUALIFICATION OF CONTRACTORS OR SUBCONTRACTORS 1 Any one of the following causes may be justification for disqualifying a Contractor from 2 further bidding , or a Subcontractor from performing work , until he has applied for and has 3 been requalified in accordance with Article 102-2 as applicable : 4 ( A ) Unsatisfactory progress in accordance with Article 108-8 .
5 ( B ) Being declared in default in accordance with Article 108-9 .
6 ( C ) Uncompleted contracts which , in the judgment of the Engineer , might hinder or prevent 7 the timely completion of additional work if awarded .
8 ( D ) Failure to comply with prequalification requirements .
9 ( E ) The submission of more than one bid for the same contract by individuals , partnerships , 10 joint ventures , LLCs or corporations whom the Department determines are under 11 sufficient common ownership and management control to warrant the firms be 12 considered a single entity .
13 ( F ) Evidence of collusion among bidders .
Each participant in such collusion will be 14 disqualified .
15 ( G ) Failure to furnish a Non-Collusion Certification , Debarment Certification or Gift Ban 16 Certification upon request .
17 ( H ) Failure to comply with Article 108-6 .
18 ( I ) Failure to comply with a written order of the Engineer as provided in Article 105-1 , if in 19 the judgment of the Engineer , such failure is of sufficient magnitude to warrant 20 disqualification .
21 ( J ) Failure to satisfy the Minority , Women or Disadvantaged Business Enterprise 22 requirements of the project special provisions .
23 ( K ) The Department has not received the amount due under a forfeited bid bond or under the 24 terms of a performance bond .
25 ( L ) Failure to submit the documents required by Article 109-10 within 60 days after request 26 by the Engineer .
27 ( M ) Failure to return overpayments as directed by the Engineer .
28 ( N ) Failure to maintain a satisfactory safety index as required by Article 102-2 .
29 ( O ) Failure to restrict a former Department employee as prohibited by Article 108-5 .
30 ( P ) False information submitted on any application , statement , certification , reports , records 31 or reproduction .
32 ( Q ) Conviction of any employee of the company , of any applicable state or federal law , may 33 be fully imputed to the business firm with which he is or was associated or by whom he 34 was employed or with the knowledge or approval of the business firm or there after 35 ratified by it .
36 ( R ) Being debarred from performing work with other Federal , State and city agencies .
37 ( S ) Failure to perform guaranty work within the terms of the contract .
38 ( T ) Failure to make prompt payment in accordance with Article 109-4 .

42 Section 103 1-21 SECTION 103 1 AWARD AND EXECUTION OF CONTRACT 2 103-1 CONSIDERATION OF BIDS 3 After the bids are opened and read , they will be compared on the basis of the summation of 4 the products of the quantities shown in the bid schedule by the unit bid prices .
The results of 5 such comparisons will be immediately available to the public .
In the event of errors , 6 omissions , or discrepancies in the bid prices , corrections to the bid prices will be made in 7 accordance with Article 103-2 .
Such corrected bid prices will be used for the comparison and 8 consideration of bids .
9 The right is reserved to reject any or all bids , to waive technicalities , to request the low bidder 10 to submit an up-to-date financial and operating statement , to advertise for new bids or to 11 proceed to do the work otherwise , if in the judgment of the Department , the best interests of 12 the State will be promoted thereby .
13 103-2 CORRECTION OF BID ERRORS 14 The provisions of this article shall apply in waiving irregularities and correcting apparent 15 clerical errors and omissions in the unit bid price and the amount bid for bid items .
16 ( A ) Paper Bid 17 ( 1 ) Omitted Unit Bid Price -- Amount Bid Completed -- Quantity Bid on is One Unit 18 In the case of a bid item for which the amount bid is completed , but the unit bid price 19 is omitted and the quantity shown in the proposal for the bid item is only one unit , 20 the unit bid price shall be deemed to be the same as the amount bid for that bid item 21 and shall constitute the contract unit price for that bid item .
22 ( 2 ) Omitted Unit Bid Price -- Amount Bid Completed -- Quantity Bid on is More Than 23 One Unit 24 In the case of a bid item for which the amount bid is completed ( extension of the unit 25 bid price by the quantity ) but the unit bid price is omitted and the quantity shown in 26 the proposal for the bid item is more than one unit , the unit bid price shall be deemed 27 to be the amount derived by dividing the amount bid for that item by the quantity 28 shown in the proposal for that bid item and shall constitute the contract unit price for 29 that bid item .
30 ( 3 ) Discrepancy in the Unit Bid Price and the Amount Bid 31 In the case of a bid item in which there is a discrepancy between the unit bid price 32 and the extension for the bid item ( amount bid ) , the unit bid price shall govern .
33 As an exception to the above , on bids for contracts not funded with any federal 34 funds , the extension for the bid item ( amount bid ) shall govern when the discrepancy 35 consists of an obvious clerical mistake in the unit bid price consisting of the 36 misplacement of a decimal point .
The correction to the unit bid price will be made 37 only when the following two conditions are met : 38 ( a ) The corrected unit bid price multiplied by the quantity equals the amount bid for 39 the bid item .
40 ( b ) The corrected unit bid price is closer to the average of the engineer 's estimate 41 and the individual bids for the contract item than the uncorrected unit bid price .
42 ( 4 ) Omitted Unit Bid Price and Omitted Amount Bid -- Deemed Zero Bid 43 ( a ) State Funded Projects 44 In the case of omission of the unit bid price and the omission of the amount bid 45 for any one item except Mobilization and , in the case of the omission of the 46 Section 103 1-22 amount bid where a lump sum price is called for , the amount bid and the unit bid 1 price shall be deemed to be zero where the value of the omitted amount bid is 2 1 % or less of the total amount bid for the entire project ( excluding the omitted 3 item ) .
The value of the omitted amount bid will be derived by determining the 4 average of the engineer 's estimate and the individual bids for that contract item .
5 Where the unit bid price is deemed to be zero as provided in this subarticle , such 6 zero unit bid price shall constitute the contract unit price for the affected bid 7 item .
8 Where the amount bid for a lump sum bid item is deemed to be zero except 9 Mobilization , as provided in this subarticle , such zero amount bid shall 10 constitute the contract lump sum price for that bid item .
11 In the case of omission of the amount bid for Mobilization , the bid shall be 12 deemed irregular and may be rejected .
13 ( b ) Federally Funded Projects 14 In the case of omission of the unit bid price and the omission of the amount bid 15 for any one item and , in the case of the omission of the amount bid where 16 a lump sum price is called for , the bid will be considered nonresponsive and will 17 not be considered for award .
18 ( 5 ) Unit Bid Prices Containing More Than Four Decimal Places 19 In the case of a Bid Item for which the amount bid contains more than 4 decimal 20 places for the Unit Bid Price , only the whole number and the first 4 decimal places 21 shall constitute the Contract Unit Price for that Bid Item .
22 ( B ) Electronic Bids 23 ( 1 ) Enter a unit price in schedule of items .
Totals will be generated automatically .
24 ( 2 ) Data incorrectly entered may not be recognized , and the bid item may remain blank 25 until entered correctly .
26 ( 3 ) Enter no more than 4 decimal places for unit price .
27 ( 4 ) Do not enter zero ( 0 ) in any unit price field unless zero is the intended bid for that 28 item .
Zero will be considered a valid bid .
However , where zeros are entered for 29 items that are authorized alternates to those items for which a non-zero bid price has 30 been submitted , zeros will be deemed invalid .
31 ( 5 ) When the proposal allows alternate bids , the bidder shall submit a unit or lump sum 32 price for every item in the proposal other than items that are authorized alternates to 33 those items for which a bid price has been submitted .
Where the bidder submits 34 a unit price other than zero for all items of an authorized alternate , the Department 35 will determine the lowest total price based on the alternate bid .
36 103-3 WITHDRAWAL OF BIDS—MISTAKE 37 ( A ) Criteria for Withdrawal of Bid 38 The Department of Transportation may allow a bidder submitting a bid pursuant to 39 NCGS § 136-28.1 for construction or repair work to withdraw his bid after the scheduled 40 time of bid opening upon a determination that : 41 ( 1 ) A mistake was in fact made in the preparation of the bid .
42 ( 2 ) The mistake in the bid is of a clerical or mathematical nature and not one of bad 43 judgment , carelessness in inspecting the work site or in reading the contract .
44 Section 103 1-23 ( 3 ) The mistake is found to be made in good faith and was not deliberate or by reason of 1 gross negligence .
2 ( 4 ) The amount of the error or mistake is equal to or greater than 3 % of the total amount 3 bid .
4 ( 5 ) The notice of mistake and request for withdrawal of the bid by reason of the mistake 5 is communicated to the Engineer within 48 hours after the scheduled time of bid 6 opening .
Upon proper notification of a mistake and request for withdrawal of bid , 7 the bidder shall submit within 48 hours written notice of mistake accompanied by 8 copies of bid preparation information to the Engineer .
The notification of a mistake , 9 request for withdrawal of bid and copies of bid preparation information shall be 10 submitted to the State Contract Officer or Engineer .
11 ( 6 ) The Department will not be prejudiced or damaged except for the loss of the bid .
12 ( B ) Hearing by the Engineer 13 If a bidder files a notice of mistake along with a request to withdraw his bid , the Engineer 14 will promptly hold a hearing thereon .
The Engineer will give to the requesting bidder 15 reasonable notice of the time and place of any such hearing .
The bidder may appear at 16 the hearing and present the original working papers , documents or materials used in the 17 preparation of the bid sought to be withdrawn , together with other facts and arguments in 18 support of his request to withdraw his bid .
The bidder shall be required to present 19 a written affidavit that the documents presented are the original , unaltered documents 20 used in the preparation of the bid .
21 ( C ) Action by Chief Engineer 22 A determination may be made by the Chief Engineer that the bidder meets the criteria for 23 withdrawal of the bid as set forth in Subarticle 103-3 ( A ) upon presentation of clear and 24 convincing evidence by the bidder .
The Engineer will present his findings to the Chief 25 Engineer for action on the bidder 's request .
The Engineer will advise the bidder of the 26 Chief Engineer ’ s decision before the Department 's consideration of award .
27 ( D ) Bid Bond 28 If a bid mistake is made and a request to withdraw the bid is made , the bid bond shall 29 continue in full force and effect until there is a determination by the Chief Engineer that 30 the conditions in Subarticle 103-3 ( A ) have been met .
The effect of the refusal of the 31 Contractor to give payment and performance bonds within 14 calendar days after the 32 notice of award is received by him , if award has been made by the Department after 33 consideration and denial of the Contractor 's request to withdraw his bid , shall be 34 governed by the terms and conditions of the bid bond .
35 103-4 AWARD OF CONTRACT 36 ( A ) General 37 The lowest responsible bidder will be notified by letter that his bid has been accepted and 38 that he has been awarded the contract .
This letter shall constitute the notice of award .
39 Where award is to be made , the notice of award will be issued within 60 days after the 40 opening of bids ; except with the consent of the lowest responsible bidder , the decision to 41 award the contract to such bidder may be delayed for as long a time as may be agreed 42 upon by the Department and such bidder .
In the absence of such agreement , the lowest 43 responsible bidder may withdraw his bid at the expiration of the 60 days without penalty 44 if no notice of award has been issued .
45 Award of a contract involving any unbalanced bid price may be made in accordance with 46 Article 102-14 .
47 Section 103 1-24 ( B ) Title VI and Nondiscrimination 1 The North Carolina Department of Transportation , in accordance with the provisions of 2 Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 ( 78 Stat .
252 ) and the Regulations of the 3 Department of Transportation ( 49 CFR , Part 21 ) , issued pursuant to such act , hereby 4 notifies all bidders that it will affirmatively insure that contracts entered in pursuant to 5 advertisements , if awarded , will be made by the Department to the lowest responsible 6 bidder without discrimination on the grounds of race , color or national origin .
7 ( 1 ) Title VI Assurance 8 During the performance of this contract , the contractor , for itself , its assignees and 9 successors in interest ( hereinafter referred to as the `` contractor '' ) agrees as follows : 10 ( a ) Compliance with Regulations 11 The contractor shall comply with the Regulation relative to nondiscrimination in 12 Federally-assisted programs of the Department of Transportation ( hereinafter , 13 '' DOT '' ) Title 49 , Code of Federal Regulations , Part 21 , as they may be amended 14 from time to time , ( hereinafter referred to as the Regulations ) , which are herein 15 incorporated by reference and made a part of this contract .
16 ( b ) Nondiscrimination 17 The Contractor , with regard to the work performed by it during the contract , 18 shall not discriminate on the grounds of race , color , or national origin in the 19 selection and retention of subcontractors , including procurements of materials 20 and leases of equipment .
The contractor shall not participate either directly or 21 indirectly in the discrimination prohibited by section 21.5 of the Regulations , 22 including employment practices when the contract covers a program set forth in 23 Appendix B of the Regulations .
24 ( c ) Solicitations for Subcontractors , Including Procurements of Materials and 25 Equipment 26 In all solicitations either by competitive bidding or negotiation made by the 27 contractor for work to be performed under a subcontract , including 28 procurements of materials or leases of equipment , each potential subcontractor 29 or supplier shall be notified by the contractor of the contractor 's obligations 30 under this contract and the Regulations relative to nondiscrimination on the 31 grounds of race , color , or national origin .
32 ( d ) Information and Reports 33 The contractor shall provide all information and reports required by the 34 Regulations or directives issued pursuant thereto , and shall permit access to its 35 books , records , accounts , other sources of information , and its facilities as may 36 be determined by the North Carolina Department of Transportation ( NCDOT ) or 37 the Federal Highway Administration ( FHWA ) to be pertinent to ascertain 38 compliance with such Regulations , orders and instructions .
Where any 39 information required of a contractor is in the exclusive possession of another 40 who fails or refuses to furnish this information the contractor shall so certify to 41 the NCDOT , or the FHWA as appropriate , and shall set forth what efforts it has 42 made to obtain the information .
43 ( e ) Sanctions for Noncompliance : 44 In the event of the contractor ’ s noncompliance with the nondiscrimination 45 provisions of this contract , the NCDOT shall impose such contract sanctions as 46 it or the FHWA may determine to be appropriate , including , but not limited to : 47 Section 103 1-25 ( i ) Withholding of payments to the contractor under the contract until the 1 contractor complies , and/or 2 ( ii ) Cancellation , termination or suspension of the contract , in whole or in part .
3 ( f ) Incorporation of Provisions 4 The contractor shall include the provisions of paragraphs ( 1 ) through ( 6 ) in 5 every subcontract , including procurements of materials and leases of equipment , 6 unless exempt by the Regulations , or directives issued pursuant thereto .
7 The contractor shall take such action with respect to any subcontractor 8 procurement as the NCDOT or the FHWA may direct as a means of enforcing 9 such provisions including sanctions for noncompliance : provided , however , that , 10 in the event a contractor becomes involved in , or is threatened with , litigation 11 with a subcontractor or supplier as a result of such direction , the contractor may 12 request the NCDOT to enter into such litigation to protect the interests of the 13 NCDOT , and , in addition , the contractor may request the United States to enter 14 into such litigation to protect the interests of the United States .
15 ( 2 ) Title VI Nondiscrimination Program 16 Title VI of the 1964 Civil Rights Act , 42 U.S.C .
2000d , provides that : “ No person in 17 the United States shall , on the grounds of race , color , or national origin , be excluded 18 from participation in , be denied the benefits of , or be subjected to discrimination 19 under any program or activity receiving Federal financial assistance. ” The broader 20 application of nondiscrimination law is found in other statutes , executive orders , and 21 regulations ( see Section III , Pertinent Nondiscrimination Authorities ) , which provide 22 additional protections based on age , sex , disability and religion .
In addition , the 1987 23 Civil Rights Restoration Act extends nondiscrimination coverage to all programs and 24 activities of federal-aid recipients and contractors , including those that are not 25 federally-funded .
26 The North Carolina Department of Transportation ( NCDOT ) hereby gives assurance 27 that no person shall on the ground of race , color , national origin , sex , age , and 28 disability , be excluded from participation in , be denied the benefits of , or be 29 otherwise subjected to discrimination under any program or activity conducted by 30 the recipient , as provided by Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 , the Civil 31 Rights Restoration Act of 1987 , and any other related Civil Rights authorities , 32 whether those programs and activities are federally funded or not .
33 During the performance of this contract , the Contractor and its subcontractors are 34 responsible for complying with NCDOT ’ s Title VI Program .
The Contractor must 35 ensure that NCDOT ’ s Notice of Nondiscrimination is posted in conspicuous 36 locations accessible to all employees and subcontractors on the jobsite , along with 37 the Contractor ’ s own Equal Employment Opportunity ( EEO ) Policy Statement .
The 38 Contractor shall physically incorporate this “ Title VI and Nondiscrimination ” 39 language , in its entirety , into all its subcontracts on federally-assisted and state- 40 funded NCDOT-owned projects , and ensure its inclusion by subcontractors into all 41 subsequent lower tier subcontracts .
The Contractor and its subcontractors shall also 42 physically incorporate the FHWA-1273 , in its entirety , into all subcontracts and 43 subsequent lower tier subcontracts on Federal-aid highway construction contracts 44 only .
The Contractor is also responsible for making its subcontractors aware of 45 NCDOT ’ s Discrimination Complaints Process , as follows : 46 ( a ) Applicability 47 These complaint procedures apply to the beneficiaries of the NCDOT ’ s 48 programs , activities , and services , including , but not limited to , members of the 49 Section 103 1-26 public , contractors , subcontractors , consultants , and other sub-recipients of 1 federal and state funds .
2 ( b ) Eligibility 3 Any person or class of persons who believes he/she has been subjected to 4 discrimination or retaliation prohibited by any of the Civil Rights authorities , 5 based upon race , color , sex , age , national origin , or disability , may file a written 6 complaint with NCDOT 's Civil Rights office .
The law prohibits intimidation or 7 retaliation of any sort .
The complaint may be filed by the affected individual or 8 a representative , and must be in writing .
9 ( c ) Time Limits and Filing Options 10 A complaint must be filed no later than 180 calendar days after the following : 11 ( i ) The date of the alleged act of discrimination ; or 12 ( ii ) The date when the person ( s ) became aware of the alleged discrimination ; or 13 ( iii ) Where there has been a continuing course of conduct , the date on which that 14 conduct was discontinued or the latest instance of the conduct .
15 Title VI and other discrimination complaints by be submitted to the following 16 entities : 17 ( d ) Format for Complaints 18 Complaints must be in writing and signed by the complainant ( s ) or a 19 representative and include the complainant ’ s name , address , and telephone 20 number .
Complaints received by fax or e-mail will be acknowledged and 21 processed .
Allegations received by telephone will be reduced to writing and 22 provided to the complainant for confirmation or revision before processing .
23 Complaints will be accepted in other languages including Braille .
24 ( e ) Discrimination Complaint Form 25 Contact NCDOT Civil Rights to receive a full copy of the Discrimination 26 Complaint Form and procedures .
27 ( g ) Complaint Basis 28 Allegations must be based on issues involving race , color , national origin , sex , 29 age , or disability as shown in Table 103-1 .
The term “ basis ” refers to the 30 complainant ’ s membership in a protected group category .
Contact the NCDOT 31 Civil Rights to receive a Discrimination Complaint Form .
