2 ( C ) Award Limits 3 A bidder who desires to bid on more than one project on which bids are to be opened on 4 the same date and who desires to avoid receiving an award of more projects than he is 5 equipped to handle , may bid on any number of projects but may limit the total amount of 6 work awarded to him on selected projects by completing the form Award Limits on 7 Multiple Projects for each project subject to the award limit .
In the event that a bidder is 8 the lowest responsible bidder on projects subject to the award limit and the value of such 9 projects is more than the award limit established by such bidder , the Department will not 10 award such bidder projects from among those subject to the award limit which have 11 a total value exceeding the award limit .
The projects to be awarded to the bidder will be 12 those projects on which award will result in the lowest total cost to the Department .
13 In determining the lowest total cost to the Department , the options of rejecting a bid or 14 readvertising for new bids may be considered .
15 All bids submitted without the properly executed form Award Limits on Multiple 16 Projects will not be subject to the award limit .
In the event that there is a discrepancy 17 between the completed award limit forms submitted by the same bidder for the different 18 projects in a letting , the Department reserves the right to declare all such award limit 19 forms invalid or to make such interpretation of the discrepancy as may be in the best 20 interests of the Department .
However , the presence of such discrepancy shall not be 21 reason for declaring any bid irregular nor shall it invalidate the conditions of his bid bond 22 or bid deposit .
23 Where a prequalified Contractor bids individually ( as opposed to a Joint Venture ) on one 24 or more projects and bids on one of more projects as part of a Joint Venture , such 25 individual bidder and such Joint Venture will be considered separate bidders in applying 26 the provisions of this article .
27 ( 1 ) Paper Bids 28 This form will be bound within each proposal .
This form will not be effective unless 29 the amount is filled in and the form is properly signed .
30 ( 2 ) Electronic Bids 31 This form is located in the .ebs miscellaneous data file of Expedite .
The bidder shall 32 click on yes or no to indicate whether or not the bidder desires to limit the award .
33 103-5 CANCELLATION OF AWARD 34 The Department reserves the right to rescind the award of a contract for any reason at any 35 time before the receipt of the properly executed contract bonds from the successful bidder .
36 103-6 RETURN OF BID BOND OR BID DEPOSIT 37 Checks that have been furnished as a bid deposit by all bidders , other than the 3 lowest 38 responsible bidders , will be retained not more than 10 calendar days after the date of opening 39 of bids .
After the expiration of such period , the checks that were furnished as a bid deposit 40 will be returned to all bidders other than the 3 lowest responsible bidders .
41 Checks that have been furnished as a bid deposit by the 3 lowest responsible bidders will be 42 retained until after the contract bonds have been furnished by the successful bidder at which 43 time the checks that were furnished as a bid deposit will be returned to the 3 lowest 44 responsible bidders .
45 Section 104 1-30 Paper bid bonds will be retained by the Department until the contract bonds are furnished by 1 the successful bidder after which all such bid bonds will be destroyed unless the individual 2 bid bond form contains a note requesting that it be returned to the bidder or the Surety .
3 103-7 CONTRACT BONDS 4 The successful bidder , within 14 calendar days after the notice of award is received by him , 5 shall provide the Department with a contract payment bond and a contract performance bond 6 each in an amount equal to 100 % of the amount of the contract .
All bonds shall be in 7 conformance with NCGS § 44A-33 .
The corporate surety furnishing the bonds shall be 8 authorized to do business in the State .
9 103-8 EXECUTION OF CONTRACT 10 As soon as possible following receipt of the properly executed contract bonds , the Department 11 will complete the execution of the contract , retain the original contract and return one copy of 12 the contract to the Contractor .
13 103-9 FAILURE TO FURNISH CONTRACT BONDS 14 The successful bidder 's failure to file acceptable bonds within 14 calendar days after the 15 notice of award is received by him shall be just cause for the forfeiture of the bid bond or bid 16 deposit and rescinding the award of the contract .
Award may then be made to the next lowest 17 responsible bidder or the work may be readvertised and constructed under contract or 18 otherwise , as the Department may decide .
19 SECTION 104 20 SCOPE OF WORK 21 104-1 INTENT OF CONTRACT 22 The intent of the contract is to prescribe the work or improvements that the Contractor 23 undertakes to perform , in full compliance with the contract documents .
In case the method of 24 construction or character of any part of the work is not covered by the plans , these 25 specifications shall apply .
The Contractor shall perform all work in accordance with the lines , 26 grades , typical sections , dimensions and other data shown in the plans , or that may be 27 modified by written orders and shall do such additional , extra and incidental work as may be 28 considered necessary to complete the work to the full intent of the plans and specifications .
29 Unless otherwise provided in the contract , the Contractor shall furnish all implements , 30 machinery , equipment , tools , materials , supplies , transportation and labor necessary for the 31 prosecution and completion of the work .
32 104-2 SUPPLEMENTAL AGREEMENTS 33 Whenever it is necessary to make amendments to the contract to satisfactorily complete the 34 proposed construction or to provide authorized time extensions , the Engineer shall have the 35 authority to enter into a supplemental agreement covering such amendments .
36 Supplemental agreements shall become a part of the contract when executed by the Engineer 37 and an authorized representative of the Contractor .
The Contractor shall file with the 38 Engineer a copy of the name or names of his representatives who are authorized to sign 39 supplemental agreements .
40 104-3 ALTERATIONS OF PLANS OR DETAILS OF CONSTRUCTION 41 The Engineer reserves the right to make , at any time during the progress of the work , such 42 alterations in the plans or in the details of construction as may be found necessary or 43 desirable .
Under no circumstances will an alteration involve work beyond the termini of the 44 proposed construction except as may be necessary to satisfactorily complete the project .
Such 45 alterations shall not invalidate the contract nor release the Surety , and the Contractor agrees to 46 perform the work as altered at his contract unit or lump sum prices the same as if it had been 47 a part of the original contract except as otherwise herein provided .
48 Section 104 1-31 An adjustment in the affected contract unit or lump sum prices due to alterations in the plans 1 or details of construction that impacts the controlling operation and materially changes the 2 character of the work and the cost of performing the work will be made by the Engineer only 3 as provided in this article .
4 If the Engineer makes an alteration in the plans or details of construction , which he 5 determines will materially change the character of the work and the cost of performing the 6 work , an adjustment will be made and the contract modified in writing accordingly .
The 7 Contractor will be paid for performing the affected work in accordance with 8 Subarticle 104-8 ( A ) .
9 When the Contractor is required to perform work that is , in his opinion , an alteration in the 10 plans or details of construction that materially changes the character of the work and the cost 11 of performing the work , he shall notify the Engineer in writing before performing such work .
12 The Engineer will investigate and , based upon his determination , one of the following will 13 occur : 14 ( A ) If the Engineer determines that the affected work is an alteration of the plans or details of 15 construction that materially changes the character of the work and the cost of performing 16 the work , the Contractor will be notified in writing by the Engineer and compensation 17 will be made in accordance with Subarticle 104-8 ( A ) .
18 ( B ) If the Engineer determines that the work is not such an alteration in the plans or details of 19 construction that materially changes the character of the work and the cost of performing 20 the work , he will notify the Contractor in writing of his determination .
If the Contractor , 21 upon receipt of the Engineer 's written determination , still intends to file a claim for 22 additional compensation by reason of such alteration , he shall notify the Engineer in 23 writing of such intent before beginning any of the alleged altered work , and the 24 provisions of Subarticle 104-8 ( B ) shall be strictly adhered to .
25 No contract adjustment will be allowed under this article for any effects caused on 26 unaltered work .
27 If the Contractor elects to file a written claim or requests an extension of contract time , it shall 28 be submitted on the Contractor Claim Submittal Form available through the Construction 29 Unit .
30 104-4 SUSPENSIONS OF WORK ORDERED BY THE ENGINEER 31 ( A ) Suspensions of the Work Ordered by the Engineer 32 When the Engineer suspends in writing the performance of all or any portion of the work 33 for a period of time not originally anticipated , customary or inherent to the construction 34 industry and the Contractor believes that additional compensation for idle equipment or 35 labor is justifiably due as a result of such suspension , the Contractor shall notify the 36 Engineer in writing of his intent to file a claim for additional compensation within 37 7 calendar days after the Engineer suspends the performance of the work and the 38 provisions of Subarticle 104-8 ( C ) shall be strictly adhered to .
39 Within 14 calendar days of receipt by the Contractor of the notice to resume work , the 40 Contractor shall submit his claim to the Engineer in writing on the Contractor Claim 41 Submittal Form available through the Construction Unit .
Such claim shall set forth the 42 reasons and support for such adjustment in compensation including cost records and any 43 other supporting justification in accordance with Subarticle 104-8 ( C ) .
44 ( B ) Alleged Suspension 45 If the Contractor contends he has been prevented from performing all or any portion of 46 the work for a period of time not originally anticipated , customary or inherent to the 47 construction industry because of conditions beyond the control of and not the fault of the 48 Contractor , its suppliers or subcontractors at any tier and not caused by weather , but the 49 Section 104 1-32 Engineer has not suspended the work in writing , the Contractor shall submit to the 1 Engineer a written notice of intent to file a claim for additional compensation by reason 2 of such alleged suspension .
No adjustment in compensation will be allowed for idle 3 equipment or labor before the time of the submission of the written notice of intent to file 4 a claim for additional compensation by reason of such alleged suspension .
Upon receipt , 5 the Engineer will evaluate the Contractor 's notice of intent to file a claim for additional 6 compensation .
If the Engineer agrees with the Contractor 's contention , the Engineer will 7 suspend in writing the performance of all or any portion of the work , and 8 Subarticle 104-8 ( C ) shall be strictly adhered to .
9 If the Engineer does not agree with the Contractor 's contention as described above and 10 determines that no portion of the work should be suspended , he will notify the Contractor 11 in writing of his determination .
If the Contractor does not agree with the Engineer 's 12 determination , Subarticle 104-8 ( C ) shall be strictly adhered to .
Within 14 calendar days 13 after the last day of the alleged suspension , the Contractor shall submit his claim to the 14 Engineer in writing on the Contractor Claim Submittal Form available through the 15 Construction Unit .
Such claim shall set forth the reasons and support for such adjustment 16 in compensation , including cost records and any other supporting justification in 17 accordance with Subarticle 104-8 ( C ) .
18 ( C ) Conditions 19 No adjustment in compensation will be allowed under Subarticles 104-4 ( A ) and 104-4 ( B ) 20 for any reason whatsoever for each occurrence of idle equipment or idle labor that has 21 a duration of 24 hours or less .
22 No adjustment in compensation will be allowed under Subarticles 104-4 ( A ) and 104-4 ( B ) 23 to the extent that performance would have been suspended by any other cause or for 24 which an adjustment is provided for or excluded under any other term or condition of the 25 contract .
26 No adjustment in compensation will be allowed under Subarticles 104-4 ( A ) and 104-4 ( B ) 27 for any effects caused on unchanged work .
No adjustment in compensation will be 28 allowed under Subarticles 104-4 ( A ) and 104-4 ( B ) except for idle equipment or idle labor 29 resulting solely from the suspension of work in writing by the Engineer .
30 No adjustment in compensation will be allowed under Subarticles 104-4 ( A ) and 104-4 ( B ) 31 where temporary suspensions of the work have been ordered by the Engineer in 32 accordance with Article 108-7 and the temporary suspensions are a result of the fault or 33 negligence of the Contractor .
34 104-5 OVERRUNS AND UNDERRUNS OF CONTRACT QUANTITIES 35 ( A ) General 36 The Engineer reserves the right to make at any time during the work such changes in 37 quantities as are necessary to satisfactorily complete the project .
Such changes in 38 quantities shall not invalidate the contract , nor release the Surety , and the Contractor 39 agrees to perform the work as changed .
The Engineer will notify the Contractor in 40 writing of the significant changes in the quantities .
41 The Contractor will be entitled to an adjustment in contract unit prices for increased costs 42 incurred over the original bid prices in performing contract items that overrun or 43 underrun the estimated contract quantities only as provided for in this article .
44 ( B ) Overruns - Increase in Unit Price 45 If the actual quantity of any major contract item overruns the original bid quantity by 46 more than 15 % of such original bid quantity , or the actual quantity of any minor contract 47 item overruns the original bid quantity by more than 100 % of such original bid quantity , 48 an increase to the contract unit price , excluding loss of anticipated profits , may be 49 Section 104 1-33 authorized by the Engineer .
Revised contract unit prices pertaining to overruns will be 1 applicable only to that portion of the overrun that is in excess of the percentages stated 2 above .
3 ( 1 ) Whenever it is anticipated that an overrun in a major or minor contract item in excess 4 of that described above will occur , the Contractor may make written request for 5 a revision to contract unit prices .
It shall be incumbent upon the Contractor to justify 6 the request for a revision to contract unit prices .
After reviewing the Contractor 's 7 request , the Engineer will notify the Contractor of his determination as follows : 8 ( a ) If the Engineer determines a revision to the contract unit price is justified and 9 the Engineer and the Contractor are in agreement as to the revision to be made 10 to the contract unit price , a supplemental agreement covering the revised 11 contract unit price will be consummated before performing work on that 12 quantity in excess of the percentage set forth above .
13 If the Engineer determines a revision to the contract unit price is justified and 14 the Engineer and the Contractor are not in agreement as to the revision to be 15 made to the contract unit price , the Engineer will issue a force account notice 16 before performing work on that quantity in excess of the percentage set forth 17 above .
18 ( b ) If the Engineer determines a revision to the contract unit price is not justified he 19 will notify the Contractor of his determination in writing and payments will be 20 made for the work at the contract unit price .
Upon completion of the work , the 21 Contractor may request an adjustment to the contract unit price as provided 22 below .
23 ( 2 ) Whenever an overrun in a contract item in excess of the percentages previously set 24 forth has occurred and a supplemental agreement establishing an increase to the 25 contract unit price has not been executed or the Engineer has not issued a force 26 account notice , the Contractor may make written request for a revision in the original 27 contract unit price .
Any adjustment to the contract unit prices due to overruns will 28 be made by the Engineer based upon his evaluation and comparison of the 29 Contractor 's documented cost records of the contract unit prices for those contract 30 items .
The Contractor 's documented cost records for the work performed on those 31 quantities beyond the percentages stated above shall be kept in accordance with 32 Article 109-3 .
The Contractor 's cost records and supporting data shall be complete 33 in every respect and in such form that they can be checked .
It shall be incumbent 34 upon the Contractor to satisfy the Engineer of the validity of any request presented 35 by the Contractor for an adjustment to the contract unit price .
After reviewing the 36 Contractor 's request , the Engineer can make such adjustment as he deems warranted 37 based upon his engineering judgment and the payment to the Contractor will be 38 made accordingly .
39 ( C ) Underruns - Increase in Unit Price 40 If the actual quantity of any major contract item underruns the original bid quantity by 41 more than 15 % of such original bid quantity , an increase to the contract unit price , 42 excluding loss of anticipated profit , may be authorized by the Engineer .
Revised contract 43 unit prices pertaining to underruns of major contract items will be applicable to the entire 44 quantity of the contract item that underruns .
No revision will be made to the contract unit 45 price for any minor contract item that underruns the original bid quantities .
46 ( 1 ) Whenever it is anticipated that an underrun in a major contract item in excess of that 47 described above will occur , the Contractor may make written request for a revision 48 to the contract unit price .
If the Engineer and the Contractor are in agreement as to 49 the revision to be made to the contract unit price , then a supplemental agreement 50 covering the revised unit price will be entered into .
If the Engineer and the 51 Section 104 1-34 Contractor are not in agreement , then after performance of the work , a revised unit 1 price may be determined as described below .
2 ( 2 ) Whenever an underrun in a major contract item in excess of the percentage 3 previously set forth has occurred and a supplemental agreement establishing 4 an increase to the contract unit price has not been executed , the Contractor may make 5 written request for a revision to the original contract unit price .
The Contractor shall 6 submit sufficient documentation and analysis of his costs to satisfy the Engineer of 7 any non-recovered costs included in the item that underran .
Any adjustment to the 8 contract unit prices due to underruns will be made by the Engineer based upon his 9 evaluation of the Contractor ’ s documentation and an analysis showing how changes 10 in contract item cost are attributable to the underrun .
An analysis of costs shall be 11 supplemented with the Contractor ’ s documented cost records for work performed on 12 the total quantity of the affected item where the Contractor ’ s request for 13 compensation includes compensation for costs other than recovered fixed costs .
14 The Contractor ’ s cost records shall be complete in every respect and in such form 15 that the Engineer can check them .
It shall be incumbent upon the Contractor to 16 satisfy the Engineer of the validity of any request presented by the Contractor for 17 adjustment to the contract unit price .
After reviewing the Contractor ’ s request , the 18 Engineer may make such adjustment as he deems warranted , based upon his 19 engineering judgment .
Payment will be made on the final estimate .
The total 20 payment , including any additional compensation granted by the Engineer due to an 21 underrun in a major contract item , shall not exceed the payment that would have 22 been made for the performance of 100 % of the original contract quantity at the 23 original contract unit price .
24 Where non-stock fabricated materials are involved in minor items that underrun or in 25 major items that underrun by less than 15 % , and where fabrication of such material 26 has begun or been completed before the Contractor is advised of the reduction in the 27 quantity of the pay item , the Department will reimburse the Contractor for the 28 verified fabrication cost , including the cost of material less salvage value , or it may 29 instruct the Contractor to have the fabricated material delivered to a site designated 30 by the Engineer and make payment for such material in accordance with 31 Article 109-6 .
32 ( D ) Overruns and Underruns - Reduction In Unit Price 33 Whenever it is anticipated that an overrun or underrun in a major contract item in excess 34 of 15 % or an overrun in a minor contract item in excess of 100 % will occur , the Engineer 35 may make written request for a reduction to the contract unit price .
If the Engineer and 36 the Contractor are in agreement as to the decrease to be made to the contract unit price , 37 a supplemental agreement covering the revised unit price will be consummated before 38 beginning work on that quantity in excess of the allowable percentages .
If the Engineer 39 and the Contractor are not in agreement as to the decrease to be made , the Contractor will 40 be directed to perform the affected work on a force account basis .
Payment for the 41 affected work will be made based upon force account records kept in accordance with 42 Article 109-3 but shall not exceed that payment that would have been made at the 43 original contract unit price .
44 104-6 ELIMINATED CONTRACT ITEMS 45 The Engineer may eliminate any item from the contract , and such action will in no way 46 invalidate the contract .
In the event the item of work involves pre-fabricated materials that 47 are not considered to be stock items and fabrication of such material is begun or completed 48 before the Contractor is advised of the elimination of the contract item , the Department may 49 reimburse the Contractor for the verified fabrication cost including the cost of materials less 50 salvage value or may instruct the Contractor to have the fabricated material delivered to a site 51 Section 104 1-35 designated by the Engineer and make payment for such material in accordance with 1 Article 109-6 .
2 If the Contractor has partially completed a contract item before notification of the elimination 3 of such item , the Department will reimburse the Contractor for the verified actual cost of the 4 partially completed work not to exceed the payment that would have been made at the 5 contract unit or lump sum price for the completed work .
6 No payment will be made for loss of anticipated profits , and no other allowance will be made 7 for eliminated items except as listed above .
8 104-7 EXTRA WORK 9 The Contractor shall perform extra work whenever it is deemed necessary or desirable to 10 complete fully the work as contemplated .
Extra work , as defined in Section 101 , shall be 11 performed in accordance with the contract and as directed .
No extra work shall be 12 commenced before specific authorization for the performance of such extra work being given 13 by the Engineer .
14 Extra work that is specifically authorized by the Engineer will be paid in accordance with 15 Subarticle 104-8 ( A ) .
16 When the Contractor is required to perform work that is , in his opinion , extra work , he shall 17 notify the Engineer in writing before performing such work .
The Engineer will investigate 18 and , based upon his determination , one of the following will occur .
19 ( A ) If the Engineer determines that the affected work is extra work , the Contractor will be 20 notified in writing by the Engineer and compensation will be made in accordance with 21 Subarticle 104-8 ( A ) .
22 ( B ) If the Engineer determines that the work is not extra work , he will notify the Contractor 23 in writing of his determination .
If the Contractor upon receipt of the Engineer 's written 24 determination intends to file a claim for additional compensation by reason of such work , 25 he shall notify the Engineer in writing of such intent before beginning any of the alleged 26 extra work and in conformance with Subarticle 104-8 ( B ) .
27 Work performed without prior written consent of the Engineer will be considered incidental to 28 the work of the contract .
29 If the Contractor elects to file a written claim or requests an extension of contract time , it shall 30 be submitted on the Contractor Claim Submittal Form available through the Construction 31 Unit .
32 104-8 COMPENSATION AND RECORD KEEPING 33 ( A ) Compensation for Articles 104-3 or 104-7 34 When the Engineer and Contractor agree that compensation is due under 35 Articles 104-3 or 104-7 , payment will be made in accordance with one of the following : 36 ( 1 ) When the Engineer and the Contractor agree to the prices to be paid , the agreement 37 will be set forth in a supplemental agreement .
If the estimated total cost of the 38 affected work is equal to or less than $ 25,000 and the prices for performing the work 39 have been mutually agreed to , the Contractor may begin work before executing the 40 supplemental agreement .
If the estimated total cost of the affected work is more than 41 $ 25,000 , the Contractor shall not begin the affected work until the supplemental 42 agreement is executed .
43 ( 2 ) When the Engineer and the Contractor can not agree to the prices to be paid for the 44 affected work , the Engineer will issue a force account notice before the Contractor 45 begins work .
In this instance the affected work shall be performed as directed by the 46 Engineer and paid in accordance with Article 109-3 .
47 Section 104 1-36 ( B ) Claim for Additional Compensation 1 The Contractor 's notice of intent to file a claim for additional compensation under 2 Articles 104-3 and 104-7 shall be given to the Engineer in writing .
The Contractor shall 3 keep accurate and detailed cost records in accordance with Article 109-3 .
The 4 Contractor 's cost records and supporting data shall be complete in every respect and in 5 such form that they may be checked by the Engineer .
The Contractor 's cost records and 6 supporting data shall clearly indicate the cost of performing the work in dispute and shall 7 separate the cost of any work for which payment has been made .
The Contractor 's cost 8 records shall be kept up to date and the Engineer shall be given the opportunity to review 9 the methods by which the records are being maintained .
The cost records shall be 10 prepared weekly for each occurrence for which notice of intent to file a claim has been 11 given and submitted to the Engineer within 7 calendar days after the end of a given 12 weekly period .
13 If the Contractor chooses to pursue the claim after the disputed work is complete , he shall 14 submit a written claim to the Engineer for an adjustment in compensation based upon his 15 cost records within 120 calendar days after completion of the disputed work .
This claim 16 shall summarize previously submitted cost records and clearly describe the Contractor 's 17 justification for an adjustment in compensation under the terms of the contract .
The 18 claim shall be accompanied by a certification from an officer of the company or person 19 authorized to execute supplemental agreements , stating that the claim is truthful and 20 accurate .
21 Upon receipt , the Engineer will review the Contractor 's request and supporting 22 documentation and notify the Contractor if the request is complete with all necessary 23 supporting documentation and cost records .
24 If the Engineer determines that the work covered by the claim is in fact compensable 25 under the terms of the contract , an adjustment in compensation will be made based upon 26 the documentation presented and his engineering judgment .
The adjustment will be made 27 on the next partial pay estimate and reflected on the final estimate .
The compensation 28 allowed shall be limited to the amount that would be paid if the work was performed in 29 accordance with Article 109-3 .
30 If the Engineer determines that the work covered by the claim is not compensable under 31 the terms of the contract , the claim will be denied .
The Engineer will notify the 32 Contractor of his determination whether or not an adjustment of the contract is warranted 33 within 120 calendar days after receipt of the complete request , all necessary supporting 34 justification and cost records .
35 The failure on the part of the Contractor to perform any of the following shall be a bar to 36 recovery under Articles 104-3 or 104-7 : 37 ( 1 ) The failure to notify the Engineer in writing before performing the work in dispute 38 that he intends to file a claim .
39 ( 2 ) The failure of the Contractor to keep records in accordance with Article 109-3 .
40 ( 3 ) The failure of the Contractor to give the Engineer the opportunity to monitor the 41 methods by which records are being maintained .
42 ( 4 ) The failure of the Contractor to submit additional documentation requested by the 43 Engineer provided documentation requested is available within the Contractor 's 44 records .
45 ( 5 ) The failure of the Contractor to submit cost records weekly .
46 ( 6 ) The failure of the Contractor to submit the written request for an adjustment in 47 compensation with cost records and supporting information within 120 calendar days 48 of completion of the affected work .
49 Section 104 1-37 ( C ) Compensation for Article 104-4 1 The Contractor 's notice of intent to file a claim for additional compensation under 2 Subarticle 104-4 ( A ) shall be given to the Engineer in writing within 7 calendar days after 3 the Engineer suspends the performance of the work .
For an alleged suspension , the 4 Contractor 's notice of intent to file a claim for additional compensation under 5 Subarticle 104-4 ( B ) shall be given to the Engineer in writing .
The Contractor shall keep 6 accurate and detailed records of the alleged idle equipment and alleged idle labor .
The 7 Contractor 's cost records , supporting data and supporting information shall be complete 8 in every respect and in such form that they may be checked by the Engineer .
The 9 Contractor 's cost records , supporting data and supporting information for equipment idled 10 due to the suspension or alleged suspension shall specifically identify each individual 11 piece of equipment , its involvement in the work , its location on the project , the requested 12 rental rate and justification as to why the equipment can not be absorbed into unaffected 13 work on the project during the period of suspension or alleged suspension .
The 14 Contractor 's cost records , supporting data and supporting information for idle labor shall 15 include the specific employees , classification , dates and hours idled , hourly rate of pay , 16 their involvement in the project and justification as to why they can not be absorbed into 17 the unaffected work on the project or other projects during the period of suspension or 18 alleged suspension .
The Contractor 's cost records , supporting data and supporting 19 information shall be kept up to date and the Engineer shall be given the opportunity to 20 review the methods by which the records , data and information are being maintained .
21 The cost records , supporting data and supporting information shall be prepared weekly 22 for each occurrence for which notice of intent to file a claim has been given and 23 submitted to the Engineer within 7 calendar days after the end of a given weekly period .
24 If the Contractor chooses to pursue the claim after the suspension or alleged suspension 25 period has ended , he shall submit a written claim to the Engineer for an adjustment in 26 compensation based upon his cost records due to idle equipment and/or idle labor within 27 14 calendar days of receipt of the notice to resume work or within 14 calendar days of 28 expiration of the alleged suspension period .
This request shall summarize previously 29 submitted cost records and clearly describe the Contractor 's justification for an 30 adjustment in compensation under the terms of the contract .
31 Upon receipt , the Engineer will evaluate the Contractor 's request .
If the Engineer agrees 32 that the cost of the work directly associated with the suspension or alleged suspension has 33 increased as a result of such suspension or alleged suspension and the suspension or 34 alleged suspension was caused by conditions beyond the control of and not the fault of 35 the Contractor , his suppliers or subcontractors at any approved tier and not caused by 36 weather , the Engineer will make an adjustment , excluding profit , and will modify the 37 contract in writing accordingly .
The Contractor will be paid the verified actual cost of 38 the idle equipment and idle labor .
The compensation allowed shall be limited to the 39 equipment , labor , bond , insurance and tax costs , excluding profits , computed in 40 accordance with Article 109-3 .
41 If the Engineer determines that the suspensions of the work by the Engineer or alleged 42 suspensions do not warrant an adjustment in compensation , he will notify the Contractor 43 in writing of his determination .
44 The Engineer will notify the Contractor of his determination of whether or not 45 an adjustment in compensation is warranted within 120 calendar days after receipt of the 46 complete request , all necessary supporting justification and cost records .
47 Section 104 1-38 The failure on the part of the Contractor to perform any of the following shall be a bar to 1 recovery under Article 104-4 : 2 ( 1 ) The failure to notify the Engineer in writing within 7 calendar days after the 3 Engineer suspends in writing the performance of all or any portion of the work .
4 ( 2 ) The failure to notify the Engineer in writing that he intends to file a claim by reason 5 of alleged suspension .
6 ( 3 ) The failure of the Contractor to keep records in accordance with the details of 7 Article 109-3 .
8 ( 4 ) The failure of the Contractor to give the Engineer the opportunity to monitor the 9 methods by which records are being maintained .
10 ( 5 ) The failure of the Contractor to submit additional documentation requested by the 11 Engineer provided the documentation requested is available within the Contractor 's 12 records .
13 ( 6 ) The failure of the Contractor to submit cost records weekly .
14 ( 7 ) The failure of the Contractor to submit the written request for an adjustment in 15 compensation with cost records , supporting data and supporting information within 16 14 calendar days of receipt of the notice to resume work .
17 ( 8 ) The failure of the Contractor to submit the written request for an adjustment in 18 compensation with cost records , supporting data and supporting information within 19 14 calendar days after the last day of the period during which the Contractor 20 contends he has been prevented from performing all or any portion of the work for 21 an unreasonable period of time ( not originally anticipated , customary , or inherent to 22 the construction industry ) because of conditions beyond the control of , and not the 23 fault of , the Contractor , its suppliers or subcontractors at any approved tier and not 24 caused by weather .
25 ( D ) Notification of Determination 26 The failure on the part of the Engineer to notify the Contractor of his determination on 27 the requested adjustment in compensation within 120 calendar days after receipt of the 28 complete request , all supporting justification and cost records will result in payment of 29 interest on any monies determined to be due from the requested adjustment in 30 compensation .
Interest , at the average rate earned by the State Treasurer on the 31 investment within the State 's Short Term Investment Fund during the month preceding 32 the date interest becomes payable , will be paid to the Contractor on the next partial pay 33 estimate and reflected on the final estimate for the period beginning on the 121st day after 34 receipt of the complete request , all supporting justification and cost records , and 35 extending to the date the Engineer makes his determination on the disputed work .
36 If the Contractor fails to receive such adjustment in compensation for the disputed work 37 as he claims to be entitled to under the terms of the contract , the Contractor may resubmit 38 the written request for an adjustment in compensation to the Engineer as a part of the 39 final claim after the project is complete .
The Contractor will only be allowed to submit 40 the request for an adjustment in compensation one time during the construction of the 41 project .
42 Section 104 1-39 104-9 DISPOSITION OF SURPLUS PROPERTY 1 All property that is surplus to the needs of the project will remain or become the property of 2 the Contractor , unless otherwise stated in the contract , with the following exceptions : 3 ( A ) Materials that are the property of utility companies providing service to buildings that are 4 to be demolished or removed in accordance with Sections 210 and 215 , 5 ( B ) Materials resulting from the removal of existing pavement in accordance with 6 Section 250 that are to be stockpiled for the use of the Department , 7 ( C ) Materials resulting from the removal of existing structures in accordance with 8 Section 402 where the contract indicates that the material will remain the property of the 9 Department , 10 ( D ) Aggregate base course where the contract requires that this material become the property 11 of the Department , 12 ( E ) Left over materials for which the Department has reimbursed the Contractor as provided 13 in Article 109-6 and 14 ( F ) Materials that have been furnished by the Department for use on the project .

22 104-10 MAINTENANCE OF THE PROJECT 23 The Contractor shall maintain the project from the date of availability or the date of beginning 24 work , whichever occurs first , until the project is finally accepted .
On resurfacing projects the 25 Contractor shall maintain each part of the project , as defined by map numbers , from the date 26 of beginning work on that part until such part is finally accepted .
This maintenance shall be 27 continuous and effective and shall be prosecuted with adequate equipment and forces to the 28 end that all work covered by the contract is kept in satisfactory and acceptable condition at all 29 times .
30 The Contractor shall maintain all existing drainage facilities , except where the work consists 31 of resurfacing only , such that they are in the same condition upon acceptance of the project as 32 they were when the project was made available to the Contractor .
33 In the event that the Contractor 's work is suspended for any reason , the Contractor shall 34 maintain the work covered by the contract , as provided herein .
35 When a portion of the project is accepted as provided in Article 105-17 , immediately after 36 such acceptance the Contractor will not be required to maintain the accepted portions .
Should 37 latent defects be discovered or become evident in an accepted portion of the project , such 38 defective work shall be repaired or replaced at no cost to the Department .
39 Where an observation period is required that extends beyond the final acceptance date , the 40 Contractor shall perform any work required by the observation period until satisfactory 41 completion of the observation period .
The Contractor will not be directly compensated for 42 any maintenance operations necessary , as this work will be incidental to the work covered by 43 the various contract items .

All parts of the 4 work shall be left in an acceptable condition .

7 104-12 VALUE ENGINEERING PROPOSAL 8 This value engineering specification is to provide an incentive to the Contractor to initiate , 9 develop and present to the Department for consideration , any cost reduction proposals 10 conceived by him involving changes to the contract .
This specification does not apply unless 11 the proposal submitted is specifically identified by the Contractor as being presented for 12 consideration as a Value Engineering Proposal ( VEP ) .
Submittals that propose material 13 substitutions of permanent features , such as , but not limited to , changes from rigid to flexible 14 or flexible to rigid pavements , concrete to steel or steel to concrete bridges will not be 15 considered acceptable VEPs .
Depending on the complexity of evaluation and 16 implementations , VEPs that provide for a total savings before distribution of less than 17 $ 10,000 may not be considered .
18 ( A ) Types of Proposals 19 VEPs contemplated are those that would result in a net savings to the Department by 20 providing a decrease in the total cost of construction or reduce the construction time 21 without increasing the cost to construct the project .
The effects the VEP may have on the 22 following items , but not limited to these items , will be considered by the Department 23 when evaluating the VEP : 24 ( 1 ) Service life , 25 ( 2 ) Safety , 26 ( 3 ) Reliability , 27 ( 4 ) Economy of operation , 28 ( 5 ) Ease of maintenance , 29 ( 6 ) Desired aesthetics , 30 ( 7 ) Design , 31 ( 8 ) Standardized features , and 32 ( 9 ) Environmental impact .
33 ( B ) Evaluation of Proposals 34 The Department reserves the right to reject the VEP or deduct from the savings identified 35 in the VEP to compensate for any adverse effects to these items that may result from 36 implementation of the VEP .
37 The Department reserves the right to reject , at its discretion , any VEP submitted that 38 would require additional right of way .
Substitution of another design alternate detailed in 39 the contract plans for the one that the Contractor bid will not be allowed .
Plan errors that 40 are identified by the Contractor and that result in a cost reduction will not qualify for 41 submittal as a VEP .
Pending execution of a formal supplemental agreement 42 implementing an approved VEP and transferal of final plans ( hard copy and electronic ) 43 sealed by an engineer licensed in the State of North Carolina incorporating an approved 44 VEP to the Resident Engineer and the State Value Management Engineer , the Contractor 45 shall remain obligated to perform in accordance with the terms of the existing contract .
46 No time extension will be granted due to the time required to review a VEP .
47 Section 104 1-41 ( C ) Subcontractors 1 The Contractor is encouraged to include this specification in contracts with 2 subcontractors .
The Contractor shall encourage submissions of VEPs from 3 subcontractors ; however , it is not mandatory that the Contractor accept or transmit to the 4 Department , VEPs proposed by his subcontractors .
The Contractor may choose any 5 arrangement for the subcontractor value engineering payments , provided that these 6 payments shall not reduce the Department 's share of the savings resulting from the VEP .
7 ( D ) Preliminary Review 8 Should the Contractor desire a preliminary review of a possible VEP , before expending 9 considerable time and expense in full development , a copy of the preliminary VEP shall 10 be submitted to the Resident Engineer and the State Value Management Engineer at 11 ValueManagementUnit @ ncdot.gov .
The submittal shall state “ Preliminary Value 12 Engineering Proposal Review Request ” and shall contain sufficient drawings , cost 13 estimates and written information that can be clearly understood and interpreted .
Include 14 the identity of any Private Engineering Firms proposed by the Contractor to prepare 15 designs or revisions to designs .
The Department will review the preliminary submittal 16 only to the extent necessary to determine if it has possible merit as a VEP .
This review 17 does not obligate the Department to approve the final VEP should a preliminary review 18 indicate the VEP has possible merit .
The Department is under no obligation to consider 19 any VEP ( Preliminary or Final ) that is submitted .
20 ( E ) Final Proposal 21 A copy of the Final VEP shall be submitted by the Contractor to the Resident Engineer 22 and the State Value Management Engineer at ValueManagementUnit @ ncdot.gov .
The 23 VEP shall contain , at a minimum , the following : 24 ( 1 ) A statement that the request for the modification is being made as a VEP .
25 ( 2 ) A description of the difference between the existing contract requirements and the 26 proposed modifications , with the comparative advantages and disadvantages of each .
27 ( 3 ) If applicable , a complete drawing of the details covering the proposed modifications 28 and supporting design computations shall be included in the final submittal .
The 29 preparation of new designs or drawings shall be accomplished and sealed by 30 an engineer licensed in the State of North Carolina .
Further , the Department may 31 require a review , and possibly the redesign , be accomplished by the project 's original 32 designer , or an approved equal .
The Department may contract with private 33 engineering firms , when needed , for reviews requested by the Department .
The 34 Contractor shall contract with the original project designer , or an approved equal , 35 when required by the Department , for any design work needed to completely and 36 accurately prepare contract drawings .
The Department may waive the requirements 37 to have the preparation of contract drawings accomplished by an engineer licensed in 38 the State of North Carolina or the project 's original design based on the extent , detail 39 and complexity of the design needed to implement the proposal .
40 ( 4 ) An itemized list of the contract requirements that would be modified and 41 a recommendation of how to make each modification .
42 ( 5 ) A detailed estimate of the cost of performing the work under the proposed 43 modification .
44 ( 6 ) A statement of the time when approval of the proposal shall be issued by the 45 Department to obtain the total estimate cost reduction during the remainder of the 46 contract , noting any effect on the contract completion or delivery schedule .
47 Section 104 1-42 ( F ) Modifications 1 To facilitate the preparation of revisions to contract drawings , the Contractor may 2 purchase reproducible copies of drawings for his use through the Department 's Value 3 Management Unit .
The preparation of new design drawings by or for the Contractor 4 shall be coordinated with the appropriate Design Branch through the State Value 5 Management Engineer .
The Contractor shall provide , at no charge to the Department , 6 one set of reproducible drawings of the approved design needed to implement the VEP .
7 Drawings ( hardcopy and electronic ) which are sealed by an engineer licensed in the State 8 of North Carolina shall be submitted to the State Value Management Engineer no later 9 than 10 business days after acceptance of a VEP unless otherwise permitted .
10 The Engineer will be the sole judge of the acceptability of a VEP requested in accordance 11 with these requirements and of the estimated net savings resulting from the approval of 12 all or any part of the VEP .
The Contractor has the right to withdraw , in whole or in part , 13 any VEP not accepted by the Department within the period to be specified in the VEP per 14 Subarticle 104-12 ( E ) ( 6 ) .
15 If a VEP is approved , the necessary changes will be effected by supplemental agreement .
16 Included as a part of the supplemental agreement will be requirements for price 17 adjustment giving the Contractor 50 % of the net savings to the project resulting from the 18 modifications .
Supplemental agreements executed for design-bid-build contracts shall 19 reflect any realized savings in the corresponding line items .
Supplemental agreements 20 executed for design-build contracts shall add one line item deducting the full savings 21 from the total contract price and one line item crediting the Contractor with 50 % of the 22 total VEP savings .
23 The Department reserves the right to include in the supplemental agreement any 24 conditions it deems appropriate for consideration , approval and implementation of the 25 VEP .
Acceptance of the supplemental agreement by the Contractor shall constitute 26 acceptance of such conditions .
27 The final net savings to be distributed will be the difference in cost between the existing 28 contract cost for the involved unit bid items and actual final cost occurring as a result of 29 the modification .
Only those unit bid items directly affected by the supplemental 30 agreement will be considered in making the final determination of net savings .
In 31 determining the estimated net savings , the Department reserves the right to disregard the 32 contract prices if , in the judgment of the Department , such prices do not represent a fair 33 measure of the value of the work to be performed or to be deleted .
Subsequent change 34 documents affecting the modified unit bid items , but not related to the VEP , will be 35 excluded from such determination .
The Department 's review and administrative costs for 36 VEPs will be borne by the Department .
The Contractor 's costs for designs and/or 37 revisions to designs and the preparation of design drawings will be borne by the 38 Contractor .
The costs to either party will not be considered in determining the net 39 savings obtained by implementing the VEP .
The Contractor 's portion of the net savings 40 shall constitute full compensation to him for effecting all changes pursuant to the 41 agreement .
The net savings will be prorated , 50 % to the Contractor and 50 % to the 42 Department , for all accepted VEPs .
43 Upon execution of the supplemental agreement , the Department will thereafter have the 44 right to use , duplicate or disclose , in whole or in part , any data necessary for the use of 45 the modification on other projects without obligation or compensation of any kind to the 46 Contractor .
Restrictions or conditions imposed by the Contractor for use of the VEP on 47 other projects shall not be valid .
48 Except as may be otherwise precluded by this specification , the Contractor may submit 49 a previously approved VEP on another project .
50 Section 104 1-43 Unless and until a supplemental agreement is executed and issued by the Department and 1 final plans ( hard copy and electronic ) sealed by an engineer licensed in the State of North 2 Carolina incorporating an approved VEP have been provided to the Resident Engineer 3 and the State Value Management Engineer , the Contractor shall remain obligated to 4 perform the work in accordance with the terms of the existing contract .
5 Acceptance of the modification and its implementation will not modify the completion 6 date of the contract unless specifically provided for in the supplemental agreement .
7 The Contractor shall not be entitled to additional compensation under Section 104 for 8 alterations in the plans or in the details of construction pursuant to the VEP .
9 The Department will not be liable to the Contractor for failure to accept or act upon any 10 VEP nor for any delays to the work attributable to any such VEP .
11 The Department reserves the right to negotiate desired changes with the Contractor under 12 the requirements of the contract even though the changes are the result of a VEP 13 submitted on another contract .
In this instance the savings will be prorated in accordance 14 with the terms of the negotiated agreement .
15 104-13 RECYCLED PRODUCTS OR SOLID WASTE MATERIALS 16 It is the policy of the Department to aid in reduction of materials that become a part of our 17 solid waste stream .
To that extent the Department encourages contractors to initiate , develop 18 and use products and construction methods that incorporate the use of recycled or solid waste 19 products in the project .
Recycled products or waste materials will be those products or 20 materials that would otherwise become solid waste and are collected , separated , or processed 21 and reused or returned to reuse in the form of raw materials or products that are incorporated 22 into a beneficial reuse on the project .
Targeted materials include , but are not limited to , the 23 following : plastic , glass , paper , cardboard , shingles , tires , fly ash , bottom ash , sludge and 24 construction and demolition debris .
25 This Specification will not be applicable to reclaimed asphalt materials used in accordance 26 with Section 610 and shall not be applicable to any recycled or solid waste materials that are 27 specified for use by the Department on the project .
28 To use recycled or solid waste materials , the Contractor shall submit to the Department of 29 Transportation a Recycled Products or Solid Waste Materials Proposal for approval .
This 30 proposal shall be submitted to the Resident Engineer and the State Value Management 31 Engineer in the Value Management Office .
The proposal shall contain , at a minimum , 32 a statement that the request for the modification is being made as a Recycled Products or 33 Solid Waste Materials proposal and the requirements in Subarticles 104-12 ( E ) ( 2 ) 34 through 104-12 ( E ) ( 6 ) .
35 The Contractor shall be responsible for obtaining any and all permits that may be required for 36 the hauling , storing , or handling of the targeted materials .
37 If a Recycled Products or Solid Waste Materials proposal is approved , the necessary changes 38 will be effected by supplemental agreement .
Included as a part of the supplemental 39 agreement will be requirements for price adjustment as follows : 40 ( A ) If the proposal results in a net savings to the Department the savings and distribution of 41 the savings shall be done in accordance with Article 104-12 .
42 ( B ) If the proposal results in a net increase in the project cost but is judged to have 43 a significant effect on the development of long term markets for the targeted materials , or 44 results in significant beneficial usage of project generated debris that would have 45 otherwise been disposed of in accordance with Section 802 , the Department will bear the 46 approved increased costs , if any .
This includes recycled products that have been 47 approved by the Department but were not originally included in this contract .
48 Section 105 1-44 ( C ) If the proposal is new and innovative , never used in the Department projects before as 1 approved by the Engineer and results in a net savings to the Department , the savings shall 2 be distributed in accordance with Article 104-12 .
However , when this innovative 3 proposal results in a net increase in project cost , Subarticle 104-13 ( B ) ( 2 ) shall apply , and 4 at least $ 500 , but not more than $ 2,500 , may be awarded to the Contractor .
5 The Contractor shall provide certification that verifies the source of the material and the 6 percentage of targeted materials to be used .
7 The quantities of reused or recycled materials either incorporated in the project or diverted 8 from landfills and any practice that minimized the environmental impacts on the project shall 9 be reported by July 1 annually by the Contractor on the Project Construction Reuse and 10 Recycling Reporting Form .
The Project Construction Reuse and Recycling Reporting Form 11 and a location tool for local recycling facilities are available on the Department ’ s web site .
12 The Contractor shall remain obligated to perform the work in accordance with the terms of the 13 existing contract pending execution of the supplemental agreement that implements 14 an approved Recycled Products or Solid Waste Materials proposal and will not be entitled to 15 any additional compensation or additional contract time if a Recycled Products or Solid Waste 16 Materials proposal is not accepted .
17 The Department reserves the right to reject , at its discretion , any Recycled Products or Solid 18 Waste Materials proposal .
The Engineer will be the sole judge of the acceptability , the value , 19 the estimated net savings and any additional compensation to be paid to the Contractor for all 20 or any part of the proposal .
21 Article 104-3 does not apply to a Recycled Products or Solid Waste Materials proposal .
22 Upon execution of the supplemental agreement , the Department will hereafter have the right 23 to use , duplicate or disclose in whole or in part any data necessary for use of the modification 24 on other projects without obligation or compensation of any kind to the Contractor .
25 Restrictions of conditions imposed by the Contractor for use of the proposal by the 26 Department on other projects shall not be valid .
27 The Department will not be liable to the Contractor for failure to accept or act upon any 28 Recycled Products or Waste Materials proposal submitted pursuant to this Specification , nor 29 for any delays to the work attributable to any third party claims , or fines that may be levied as 30 a result of the Contractor 's decision to use targeted materials .

This construction schedule will remain in 4 effect until such time as the Contractors , at their option submit to the Engineer a joint 5 construction schedule meeting the approval of the Engineer .
This joint construction schedule 6 shall be signed by authorized representatives of each firm and upon the approval of the 7 Engineer shall be binding on each firm .

42 Section 105 1-49 If the Engineer requests it , the Contractor , at any time before final acceptance of the work , 1 shall remove or uncover such portions of the finished work as may be directed .

18 105-12 UNAUTHORIZED WORK 19 No work shall be performed without established lines and grades except as otherwise 20 permitted by the Engineer .

Any of the above work so performed may be ordered removed , 26 replaced , or repaired at no cost to the Department .

32 105-13 LIMITATIONS OF OPERATIONS 33 At any time when , in the opinion of the Engineer , the Contractor has obstructed , closed , or is 34 conducting operations on a greater portion of the work than is necessary for the prosecution of 35 the work so as to constitute a hazard to the general public or impair the function of the facility 36 being constructed where traffic shall be maintained , the Engineer may require the Contractor 37 to suspend such unnecessary operations or closures and to finish the portions on which work 38 is in progress before starting work on additional portions of the work .

44 105-15 RESTRICTION OF LOAD LIMITS 45 The Contractor shall comply with all legal load restrictions in hauling equipment and 46 materials on roads under the jurisdiction of the Department .
47 Section 105 1-50 The Department has the right to place load limit restrictions on the load a Contractor may haul 1 on any road or bridge in the vicinity of his contract .
The Contractor , before bidding on 2 a project , will be responsible for making his own investigations to determine the possibility of 3 load limit restrictions being placed on any of the highways he plans to use for hauling 4 purposes .
The Contractor shall not be entitled to an extension of time or to compensation for 5 any costs , inconvenience , delay , or any other adversity to the Contractor as the result of any 6 reduction by the Department in load limit , or as the result of a refusal by the Department to 7 raise load limits as hereinafter provided or under any other conditions .
Any such reduction in 8 load limit or refusal to raise load limits shall not constitute a basis for a claim for additional 9 compensation .
10 Wherever load limit restrictions below the statutory legal load limit have been posted on any 11 roads and bridges on the project or within the vicinity of the project , the Department may 12 remove the load limit restrictions from such roads and bridges upon written request from the 13 Contractor , and the Contractor thereafter will be allowed to haul up to the statutory legal 14 limits over such roads and bridges , provided the Contractor enters into an agreement with the 15 Department providing for : 16 ( A ) Maintenance by the Contractor of such roads in a condition satisfactory to the Engineer 17 during the haul period .
18 ( B ) Repair by the Contractor at his expense , of all damages to such roads after haul is 19 completed to place them in a condition as good as they were before removal of the load 20 limits .
21 ( C ) Furnishing a bond by the Contractor in an amount determined by the Engineer for the 22 roads .
Furnishing a bond for the roads does not entitle the Contractor to exceed the 23 posted load limits of any bridge .
24 ( D ) Assumption by the Contractor of all costs of strengthening any bridges that may be 25 necessary to safely haul loads up to statutory legal limits .
The Department will , upon 26 request by the Contractor , make a determination as to the method and extent of 27 strengthening required for the bridges and will advise the Contractor as to the amount of 28 work to be done or an estimate of the charges for the work if performed by Department 29 forces .
When Department forces perform the work , the Contractor shall reimburse the 30 Department in the amount of the actual charges for said work .
When Contractor 's forces 31 perform the work , it shall be done in accordance with plans approved by the Engineer and 32 under his inspection .
33 ( E ) Indemnification of the Department against any and all claims from third persons arising 34 out of or resulting from the hauling operation or the maintenance , or lack of maintenance , 35 of haul roads .
Haul roads shall be maintained for the Contractor 's hauling operations and 36 for the use of the general public .
37 Equipment operated on proposed bridges shall comply with load restrictions in Table 105-1 .
38 TABLE 105-1 RESTRICTIONS FOR EQUIPMENT ON BRIDGES Property Maximum Load in Pounds Axle load 36,000 Axle load on tandem axles 30,000 Gross load 90,000 The Contractor shall keep the bridge floor clean to reduce impact forces and place approved 39 temporary guides on the bridge floor to position the wheel loads as nearly as possible over the 40 bridge girders .
Only one earth-moving vehicle shall be on a bridge at any time .

14 105-17 INSPECTION AND ACCEPTANCE 15 Upon completion of the entire project as determined by the Engineer , the Engineer will 16 inspect the project for final acceptance .
If all construction provided for and contemplated by 17 the contract is found to be satisfactorily completed , the project will be accepted .
The 18 acceptance of projects in their entirety will not be altered except as listed below : 19 ( A ) When any continuous project is equal to or in excess of 5 miles in length , the Department 20 will accept the project in two increments with the first increment equaling at least 50 % of 21 the total length of the project .
22 ( B ) Under resurfacing contracts , the Department will accept the project in parts as defined by 23 map numbers representing at least 25 % of the total length of project .
24 ( C ) When it is considered to be in the best interest of the Department , other increments or 25 parts of projects may be considered for acceptance .
26 ( D ) When the contract contains an intermediate completion date requiring the completion of 27 a portion of the work in its entirety , such portion of the work may be accepted if 28 requested in writing by the Contractor .
29 ( E ) Bridge decks and rails that have been constructed or rehabilitated at such time as when 30 they are open to public traffic .
31 ( F ) Permanent sign panels , including hardware and retroreflective sheeting , that are located 32 where the roadway is open to public traffic and that are required to be installed before the 33 final acceptance of the project .
34 Acceptance of any increment or part of a project shall not operate to waive the assessment of 35 all or any portion of liquidated damages assessable under the terms of the contract .
36 When the inspection discloses any work , in whole or in part , as being unsatisfactory or 37 incomplete , the Engineer will advise the Contractor of such unsatisfactory or incomplete 38 work , and the Contractor shall immediately correct , repair or complete such work .
The 39 project will not be accepted and the Contractor shall be responsible for the maintenance of the 40 project and maintenance of traffic until all of the recommendations made at the time of the 41 inspection have been satisfactorily completed .
42 The Engineer will notify the Contractor in writing that the project has been accepted as soon 43 as practicable after the completion of the project .
When an observation period is required that 44 extends beyond the final acceptance date , the satisfactory completion of the observation 45 period shall be covered by the contract bonds .

43 Section 106 1-53 ( B ) Domestic Steel 1 All steel and iron products that are permanently incorporated into this project shall be 2 produced in the United States except minimal amounts of foreign steel and iron products 3 may be used provided the combined material cost of the items involved does not exceed 4 0.1 % of the total amount bid for the entire project or $ 2,500 , whichever is greater .
If 5 invoices showing the cost of the material are not provided , the amount of the bid item 6 involving the foreign material will be used for calculations .
This minimal amount of 7 foreign produced steel and iron products permitted for use is not applicable to high 8 strength fasteners .
Domestically produced high strength fasteners are required .
9 All steel and iron products furnished as domestic products shall be melted , cast , formed , 10 shaped , drawn , extruded , forged , fabricated , produced , or otherwise processed and 11 manufactured in the United States .
Raw materials including pig iron and processed 12 pelletized and reduced iron ore used in manufacturing domestic steel products may be 13 imported ; however , all manufacturing processes to produce the products , including 14 coatings , shall occur in the United States .
15 Before each steel or iron product is incorporated into any project or included for partial 16 payment on a monthly estimate , the Contractor shall furnish the Engineer a notarized 17 certification certifying that the product conforms to the above .

39 106-3 CONTRACTOR FURNISHED CERTIFICATION 40 The Contractor shall furnish the Department material certifications obtained from the 41 producer , supplier or an approved independent testing laboratory for the following types of 42 materials , unless otherwise directed by the Engineer : 43 ( A ) Materials required to meet criteria documented by tests that are normally performed 44 during the production process ; 45 ( B ) Materials that are required to meet specifications other than those published by 46 AASHTO , ASTM or the Department ; 47 ( C ) Materials produced at locations that are not within routine travel distance for Department 48 representatives ; 49 Section 106 1-54 ( D ) Materials required to meet criteria documented by tests involving special equipment not 1 readily available to Department representatives ; and 2 ( E ) Any other special material when so directed by the Engineer .
3 Material certifications of one of the following types shall be furnished for pre-tested 4 materials .
The specific type of material certification for each material shall be in accordance 5 with the schedule maintained by the Materials and Tests Unit .
Copies of this schedule may be 6 obtained from the Materials and Tests Unit .
7 Type 1 - Certified Mill Test Report 8 A certified mill test report shall be a certified report of tests conducted by the manufacturer on 9 samples taken from the same heat or lot number as the material actually shipped to the 10 project .
The report shall identify the heat or lot number .
11 Type 2 - Typical Certified Mill Test Report 12 A typical certified mill test report shall be a certified report of tests conducted by the 13 manufacturer on samples taken from a lot that is typical of the material actually shipped to the 14 project , but that may or may not be from the lot shipped .
15 Type 3 - Manufacturer 's Certification 16 A manufacturer 's certification shall be a certified statement that the material actually shipped 17 to the project was manufactured by production processes that are periodically and routinely 18 inspected to assure conformance to specification requirements .
19 Type 4 - Certified Test Reports 20 A certified test report shall be a certified report of test conducted by an approved independent 21 testing laboratory on samples taken from the same heat or lot number as the material actually 22 shipped to the project .
The report shall identify the heat or lot number .
23 Type 5 - Typical Certified Test Reports 24 A certified test report shall be a certified report of tests conducted by an approved 25 independent testing laboratory on samples taken from a lot that is typical of the material 26 actually shipped to the project , but that may or may not be from the lot shipped .
27 Type 6 - Supplier 's Certification 28 A supplier 's certification is a signed statement by the supplier that the material described in 29 the certification is of the specification grade required and that the supplier has on hand Type 1 30 or Type 2 material certifications to cover the material that is included in the Type 6 supplier 's 31 certification .
32 Type 7 - Contractor 's Certification 33 Contractor ’ s certification is a signed statement by a contractor that the used material described 34 in the certification meets the current specifications to the best of the contractor ’ s knowledge 35 and that the contractor had in his possession at the time of purchase a Type 1 36 or Type 2 material certification to cover the material that is included in the 37 Type 7 Contractor ’ s certification .

21 The Engineer may direct the Contractor to re-weigh the contents of any truck load that is to be 22 delivered to the work on approved platform scales at no cost to the Department .
